description:
True score: 4.5 (.5 off for the Mac n cheese)

Love this place!! 

I've been coming to WoP for some time now and I absolutely love this place. The food is always superb and the employees are attentive and knowledgeable. I generally sit at the bar and Martine and Pedro are super kind! Coming from someone who works in the industry, I really value quality customer service. Lately I've been opting for the cushioned booths in the bar area. So this review is based mainly on our server Johnny.. he was sweet and made our experience so much better.... if that's even possible.

Normally I order the queso but decided to branch out this time. My friend and I ended up ordering the flautas and the Mac n cheese. We weren't too thrilled with the Mac n cheese, it happened to be a little too sweet for our liking. We told our server and he offered to exchange it for something else. We ended up doubling down on the flautas because of how yummy they were. PLEASE ORDER THESE IF YOU COME HERE!!! 

Overall:
Major thanks to Johnny for making our experience one of the best we've had here (try to sit in his section) and order the flautas. If you can't or don't sit in his section, ask for Martine or Pedro at the bar, still 11/10!!

West of Pecos really does have the best staff and some of the best food. Quality for sure!!
author: Alexandra S.

description:
Had the carnitas puffy taco and the fried chicken and churros from their brunch menu. I was intrigued by what a puffy taco was, and after having tried it, I think I will stick to regular tacos. The flavor profile was good, and the meat and toppings were overflowing to the point that you can't really close the taco -- fork and knife is the best way to eat it (not a bad thing, but FYI).

The fried chicken and churros was pretty bad IMO. The fried chicken lacked flavor; it's just chicken fried in really bland batter. The churros were lacking -- texture was quite hard. I think this dish was supposed to mimic the concept of fried chicken and waffles, and I personally thought it wasn't a great combination.

I really want to try their dinner menu, but I'm a huge NO on their brunch.
author: Lillian T.

description:
Not planning to come back to this place again mainly because of the issue my bf and I had with the hostess. We were put on the waitlist and were told that she would text him when our table is ready. 45 minutes passed, and we were only supposed to wait for 30 minutes. My bf confronted the hostess about this, and she said she texted him, but he didn't respond, so she gave our table away. That's fine if that was the case, but he NEVER received the text!
His cell phone service was working just fine, and they had the correct phone number because the automatic texts were sent earlier informing us that they would text us when the table was ready. He was receiving texts from other people and notifications, but he never got the text from the hostess. This was so frustrating, because she KNEW that we were waiting for our table at the bar. She could've briefly stopped by the bar to tell us our table was ready. Instead, she blamed it on him that he didn't get the text because of his cell service (which was clearly NOT the case!). She did not even try to get us the next indoor table immediately, but shrugged it off.
Since we didn't have our table anymore, we ended up just having dinner at the bar, and it took forever for our food to come out. Because of the whole table fiasco, we ended up not having dinner until 1 hour and 15 minutes after we arrived. 

As for the food...
Brisket puffy taco: my bf had one and he liked it. (5/5)

Duck puffy taco: it was a bit too sweet for me. The taco shell was already kind of sweet to begin with, but the duck was sweet as well, so the whole thing tasted like a sugar bomb. (2/5)

Shrimp fajitas: I really liked this. Such warm and soft flour tortillas, and the skillet was piping hot. Lots of bell peppers, onions, and good amount of shrimp. Comes with a heap of guac and rice and beans. (5/5)

Cocktails were pretty good too. We would've had a much better experience if the hostess admitted her mistake and made the effort to fix it. If you come here, make sure you ask about your table to the host or hostess near the end of your supposed wait time (or else you'll just be waiting endlessly for nothing), and hopefully they will seat you right away even if he/she forgets to text you.
author: Christina W.

description:
Yummy delicious and strong drinks!

Tried their prickly pear margarita and fell in LOVEE. The drink was hot pink to begin with which was super attractive and pretty. It was literally the most ordered drink in the bar from what I've observed. But the taste was what blew me away the most. Spicy from the serrano peppers yet strong, sweet, and citrusy from the fruit and alcohol. The drink was really good! Besides that, I also ordered the La Flama Verde which is similar to to the prickly pear in that it has a spicy kick! Made with tequila, lime, cucumber, genepy, and jalapeno, the drink was spicy and refreshing. Both margaritas were $12 each. My bf, on the other hand, got two Shot (tequila) and Beer combo for $12 each! sucha steal since a shot is already $11. 

As for food, we tried their guac, mac&cheese, and steak fajitas. The guac ($11) and mac&cheese ($10) were really yummy. Chunky fresh pieces of avocados mixed with tomatoes. I really liked the mixture of tomatoes actually. Gave more flavor to the guac. The mac&cheese is my ultimate favorite of the night. It's probably the best mac and cheese I've ever tried (forreal). SUPER creamy, cheesy, and delicious. The cast iron kept the mac&cheese hot and creamy throughout the whole meal. MUST TRY! the Steak Fajitas ($22), on the other hand, was a total bust. The meat was very tough and hard to chew- tad bit overcooked. I told the server about the hard steak and they accommodated us. Super nice of them, thus the 4 star instead of 3. 

Overall, drinks were great, ambiance is nice and cool to look at (they had these dangling lights with chilis!), food was good, and service was so-so. Waited a bit for our waitress to pop up when we were done and ready for the check but she was nowhere to be seen so my bf had to go up to the hostess to ask for it. Don't think we saw her after our food arrived and she checked in on us once. But she was nice when she did take our order and she also recommended me La Flama Verde. 

Will definitely return to try the other food and margaritas!
author: Anissa D.

description:
Came here with a friend and it's a cool Tex Mex restaurant. To be honest I don't eat a lot of Tex Mex food but this place was really awesome! We had the infamous puffy tacos and the guacamole and chips which were both awesome. The guacamole and chips was around $11 each and I ordered the BBQ braised beef puffy taco and the crispy carnitas puffy taco ($7 each). The menu has an extensive selection of alcoholic beverages! They have around 6 pages on the menu dedicated to drinks and 2 pages to just good.

I loved the BBQ braised beef one it was so good with some kind of savory mayonnaise sauce and a bit of sliced pickles on top to add some sourness and acidity. The carnitas was also pretty good, but instead of being crispy it kind of felt just touch and not cooked that well, so that one wasn't "crispy" but kind of like dry and tough?

If I didn't have the braised beef taco I probably wouldn't come back, but that taco is so great, it gives me hope that other things are super good. I heard the Queso is good and would love to come back and try it out.

The service was pretty good, everybody was super polite and the environment is quiet and dim but can get loud sometimes because people are consuming alochol.
author: Christopher L.

description: Haven't been to this restaurant in a while. With how much restaurants in SF have been raising prices, this place is definately one of the most affordable now. Everything tasted fabulous as usual. Service was super quick. The waitress refilled water and chips before we even asked. Food here tends to take longer but with how often they refill chips, I cant complain. Portion sizes are pretty good. Also if you can, always sub for the cornbread. I didn't I would ever crave cornbread until I tried the one at this restraunt.
author: Diane Z.

description: We ordered the impossible burger, tostadas, queso burger, and the ceviche. The burger was dry, the tostada tortilla was stale, and they gave us 3 chips with the ceviche. I really want to like this place, but unfortunately, the quality is just not there.
author: Jie L.

description:
I really think this place should have 3.5 stars, as the drinks were excellent, the ambiance is wonderful, but the food did not blow me away. 

We came to West of Pecos because someone had just rear-ended us (yay SF driving) and we needed a strong drink. 

It was a Saturday around 4, during that in between time between brunch and dinner. We were one of the only parties there. 

We asked for margaritas, and the tequila was exactly what we needed to calm our nerves. I believe we got La Casa Margaritas. 
We got more of them just to make sure we had fully recovered. On the basis of the drinks alone, I would rate this place 4 stars. 

The guac and chips that we ordered were just okay. We also got the green Chile Mac and Cheese because I love Mac and Cheese. The Mac and Cheese did have a nice kick to it, but it was really just okay. I should have gotten more margaritas.
author: Jenée S.

description:
Friendly service, great happy hour! Good flavors!
Nice tejas like ambiance. Easy to find.
author: Ashley P.

description:
Wow can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. I guess now is as good time as any as I procrastinate working.

Their Queso has become a personal favorite; I crave it. The frozen margs are strong and tasty, the happy hour menu is great - get the nachos! They're big enough to share and the cheese is very yummy. The puffy tacos (not on the hh menu) are so delish - get the pork, it's so tender and flavorful. 

Lots of good options for drinks, hh, and dinner. Highly recommend. Not too expensive, but you can definitely run up a tab. Enjoy, Yelpers!
author: Crystal C.

description:
Really nice options for vegetarians. The impossible burger was yummy but I have to say that Gotts does it better. The street cart corn was just ok, the elites at Taco Orgasmico is the best I ave ever tried. I don't know why they brought it with the meal I stead of as an apatizer.
Service was friendly and the location is always fun.
The ginger beer was really really good.
Overall a good place but probably I will not become a regular
author: Nils H.

description:
Came here for Taco Tuesday, so review is for that.

Making a reservation and getting seated was easy and quick. This place is aesthetically pleasing, food looks great, but the flavor is not necessarily all there. We got the chips and guac, which was pretty good, chips were crisp and guac was chunky. Could use a bit more salt on the guac. We also tried all the hard shell tacos, one of each. The only one that stood out was the beef with queso. The queso really made this particular taco come full circle, whereas the other flavors were overall dry with little flavor. I would definitely recommend the beef and queso taco, you can skip all the other flavors. We also got the spicy margarita, it was pretty good! Get a pitcher and share with a friend!
author: Eva C.

description:
I was in a bit of a grumpy mood upon entering this spot, but was pleasantly surprised by the food here. The place is decorated with a Tex-Mex sort of atmosphere-- the lights from the ceiling are dangling rows of chiles intertwined with red Christmas lights, there are street signs on the walls, and long wooden tables.

I shared the buttermilk fried chicken. The biggest thing for me about this place is that the chicken came out HOT. Not lukewarm, or pretty hot, but HOT. The skin was crispy but not too thick, salted perfectly, and slightly crumbled when you bit into it. I'm not normally a huge fan of fried chicken, but this really stood out to me. The meat was flavorful and moist. 4.25/5.

The creamed corn side was delightful. Creamy, perfect comfort food with just the right amount of sweet and salt. 4/5.

The spinach was garlicky and oiled up without being too overcooked. It's always great when a restaurant includes some veggies that are well cooked! 4/5.

Mashed potatoes were fairly standard, but who doesn't love mashed potatoes? 3.5/5.
--

Friday is cheat day at work, and today was enchilada day! The cilantro cabbage slaw had just the right amount of sour to stimulate the appetite, and was clearly fresh given the crunch. The black beans were fairly standard / not goopy.

I got to check out an assortment of enchiladas (pork, beef, and chicken). The pork enchilada was melt in your mouth tender (almost mashed) on the inside, which I was a fan of since I'm lazy and like baby food-like consistencies. The wrapper was a bit more firm than I would've liked, but I think that is how it is supposed to be.  The chicken had some chicken flavor that was good, same consistency as the pork. Beef, same consistency. 

The churro was a fried crisp, covered in sugar. Heart attack as a stick. I personally like my churros more chewy, but tomato tomahtoh.

3.25/5 on delivery, but I think that's the nature of delivery.
author: Nicole H.

description:
This review is long, long overdue. West of Pecos has become a favorite spot of ours since a friend casually introduced me to their happy hour a couple years ago. We've since been back for more HH margaritas, formal dinners, brunches with friends, and most recently a Mother's Day brunch. I can now say with absolute certainty that you cannot go wrong at West of Pecos. The food, drinks, service and vibe are all wonderful, and we'll undoubtedly continue coming here to work our way through the menu. 

Some tips for success: Make a reservation if you're coming on a weekday for brunch or on a Friday or Saturday night for dinner. If you have a choice, sit outside in the mornings - they have a heat lamp and small fireplaces outside that will keep you comfortable on a breezy SF morning. In the evening, the tall tables near the bar are a bit more fun than the dining room, depending on the evening you're going for. 

Go big: Order anything that looks good, which is everything. The leftovers are great (even day-old soggy churros and chicken), and you'll want to try more than just your entree. Prices are incredibly reasonable for the quantity and quality of the food ($12-$15/entree on avg.). The Chicken & Churros are not to be missed, along with the Guacamole and Sopapillas. 

Ignore your 'diet': This is not your kale-salad cafe. This is food that warms your soul, so let your hair down and get that second (or third) margarita. The SF area is suffering a severe drought of Tex-Mex restaurants, so appreciate what you've got! 

This place even gets two thumbs up from my El Paso-raised madre. They even do rice right, which is a big deal. Huge kudos to the guys in the back, who keep this place worth coming back to again and again. 

Already looking forward to our next visit!
author: Laura B.

description:
I *was* super excited to finally get some Tex Mex food (one of my favorites) in the bay... But frankly West of Pecos let me down.

AMBIENCE: I actually really like the vibe of this place. There are lit up red chili decorations (v southwestern ) and bulls and snakeskin and cowboy figurines and basically any other Texan thing you can imagine.

FOOD: My dining companion and I split the sopapillas with honey to start. It was OK. The sopapillas are very fluffy, but too bready for my liking. I also wish they had made it a savory sopapilla since it's an appetizer.

The veggie chile relleño had fairly high reviews on Yelp, so I gave that a go. The chile itself was slightly bland. It was fried in the same batter as (or at least one similar to) was used for the sopapillas, so that was pretty flavorless. The filling was quite mild compared to the chile relleños I've had in other places. The sides were also pretty flavorless, and I didn't particularly like the salsa that came with the chile relleño. In summary, not my favorite dish.

My dining companion got a green chile queso burger. He said it was decent, though it was quite mild for a green chile burger.

Overall I'd say West of Pecos is just average. It's a cute place to get drinks and chips, but I'm not inclined to return for dinner.
author: Varsha V.

description:
West of Pecos was pretty good "Tex-Mex", I went in with an open mind since I literally grew up eating Tex-Mex in Texas. They honestly did not disappoint. 

I went with friends and we were seated promptly at a table in the bar area. We ordered a pitcher of the Pecos classic margaritas, they were pretty damn good and strong. Pro-tip: ask for a tajin rim and not just the smoked salt on your glass, it'll give a nice little kick. The margaritas are fresh though and not a store bought mix, which is always an instant plus in my book. 

We all shared the chips and guac as an appetizer, the guac was chunky and nice, you could tell it was freshly made. They give a decent amount. The chips are thick enough so that your chip won't break when you go to grab guac. I ordered the green chile burger for lunch, it was very very good. It of course is beef and it comes with green chile queso, my only warning is that the burger is super messy but worth it for sure. 

The bartender was super attentive and it was an overall great experience. I would definitely go back again but for the dinner menu, when I went it was still brunch menu and I wanted nachos.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
My new favorite spot in SF! First and foremost, THE PRICKLY PEAR MARGARITA. I am obsessed with this drink. Not only is it the perfect shade of hot pink, it's a full bodied, delicious margarita. 

For appetizers you've got to go with the queso. It is heavenly. Perfect consistency and just enough food to tide you over before your entree. Yum yum delicious.

For entrees I've tried both the fish tacos and chile relleno. Both of these choices were incredibly flavorful but I prefer the chille relleno. What's not to love about a deep fried pepper?

Excellent service, festive ambiance, incredible food. 5 stars for West of Pecos baby!
author: Nicole W.

description: Pretty damn good Americanized Mexican food influenced by Western BBQ! A good place for groups.
author: Lisa F.

description:
3.5 Stars.

West of Pecos is a great looking restaurant that serves Okay Mexican inspired food.

I happened to have two of my children in town and they wanted to check out a mexi restaurant in the mission. I had West of Pecos on my yelp bookmarks for years. So we gave it a shot.

Two things that are really great about WoP's are the service and the ambiance. Our servers were outstanding: fast, efficient, and polite.
The ambiance is fun,festive, and colorful.

The food is where I found West of Pecos somewhat lacking. Yes the menu is  varied..but the flavors were rather meh!

The Puffy crunchy carnitas were lacking in flavor and texture. The pork was not really seasoned well and not cooked to a crunch.

The pork enchiladas were okay but served luke warm.

Fire roasted chile Relleno sounded great but was what you would serve a Gringo...no bueno...no flavor

The Green chile mac and cheese sounded like an amazing idea but the flavor wasn't really bold.

We did like the crab guacamole...great idea and neat mixture of creamy avocado and salty briny crab...yummy.

The queso dip with chorizo was also really good. Great with the chips!

Would I come back???

Yes but I probably would get appetizers and drinks and just take in the warm and wonderful ambiance.
author: David G.

description: First the pros. I lived in New Mexico for many years and the decor is perfect right down to the adobe fireplaces.  Our Drinks were great, queso great. I was hoping for more New Mexican specialities but maybe it's focus is tex mex? Christmas style everything should be an option with real Hatch Green Chile, Green Chile Stew, Navajo Tacos, Frito Pie and stuffed Sopapillas. We will be back because it's the best Southwest we have found in SF and a great happy our spot.
author: Susan S.

description:
I love this place for Tex-Mex but like if the chef really went in and put thought into the menu. 
We always get the cornbread (divine) and the crab guacamole (generous crab serving!), but other food items are pretty solid from the fish tacos to the shrimp fajitas. Their margaritas are legit! My date last night had the prickly pear marg - which was slightly spicy (serranos) but not overpowering. And a really pretty pink lol.

But deffffinitely make a reservation because they get so busy even on weeknights.
author: Farrah N.

description:
You know that feeling you get when you're intoxicated at 2am and you drive through a fast food place to order a crunchy taco and it tastes like the best thing in the world? 
Well, that's what they taste like here. In broad daylight. Minus the hangover... but that may come later from all the margaritas you'll want to have. 

No more waiting for Taco Tuesday deals! Just come to the bar between 5-6:30 M-F and order from the happy hour menu. $3 tacos. $4 beers. $8 house margaritas, wings, or sliders. 

You can choose duck, pork, beef, chicken, or bean tacos. My favorite were the pork with green chile and the beef brisket with queso.

From the regular menu, I liked the slow roasted pork enchiladas with avocado, green chile, and queso fresco. It's spicy, tangy, and delicious. 

The queso and chips with house made chorizo is a great appetizer to share, but eat it before it gets cold. 

The street cart corn with lime crema and queso fresco is a nice crunchy vegetarian option.

From the brunch menu, I highly HIGHLY recommend the buttery biscuits with strawberry jam. They are divine!

My two favorite margaritas are The In-Famous El Guapo, made with blood orange & pineapple; and the Prickly Pecos, spicy with serrano and prickly pear. The colors and fruit flavors are amazing. 
These are also available by the pitcher ;)

The decor is pretty cool- old western with wooden counters, white Christmas lights, and a big screen playing The Three Amigos or a classic Clint Eastwood film that make you feel like you might be in a cantina in Mexico. 

Check out the fireplaces in the front patio too!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
This place is really fun and the food is very good. I came here for a group birthday dinner gathering and highly recommend it for group events as they have a very creative, filling, and affordable prix fixe menu for parties.

The only negative is the slowness. They really do take a long time bringing food over, but if that's not a huge concern, it gives you more time to mingle and enjoy the super fun atmosphere.
author: Amy G.

description: NICE lunch - we split the three fish tacos, deluxe queso, a glorious combination of health and sin. The draft Modelo and juicy IPA were icy cold and hit us just fine.
author: Adom K.

description: Wow! Delicious food and drinks! We had the grilled entree and the chile relleno. The corn is their best dish, but everything was good. I would give 5 stars but there was only one vegan dish on the menu. It was amazing, and huge and just delicious, but it was the only option. I'm perfectly happy with the option, but it seems like all of their dishes would be good if they made them vegan. The cheese on the chile relleno smelled very strongly, and bad. But the vegan cashew cream smelled and tasted incredible.
author: Jim H.

description:
I love the atmosphere & the food at this place. Their green Chile Mac & cheese is up there in my list of best places with Mac & cheese. Their queso and selection of sauces is also phenomenal.

My favorite thing by far is definitely the Cactus Bowl. This is a magical hibiscus, mezcal concoction that is the perfect amount of alcoholic to leave two people pleasantly buzzed.

Whether you're with a large group, or a small group, highly recommend this place for a solid night out.
author: Maansi D.

description:
Friendly staff. 
Clean. 
Open Feels/Spacious

I went for a late lunch on a Saturday : it was semi - crowed but not crazy. The menu didn't have too many options. I think it was still "brunch" ..

But, anyway............ 

I order two (2) the "Puff Taco's" w| carnitas + a side of rice and beans. 
In all honest , i should have only ordered one (1) Puff Taco ONLY. 
Personally : I was full off ONE Puff Taco, the puffness fills you. So, I just ate one whole Taco, then meat + toppings off the second one. The meat was delicious. The Puff "tortilla" of it was good but had a sweet taste to it, almost like a Churro ? Which wasn't BAD - just unexpected. 
Made w| some love.

However, the side of rice and beans. PASS. Not good at all. I'm Mexican, and i KNOW good rice + beans. The rice was kind of hard, and the beans just weren't good.
Defiantly wasn't made with love.

It's not a horrible place, you'd have to go yourself to get your own opinion, but i wouldn't not, not go again.
author: Silvia R.

description: I haven't had quality Tex mex since moving from Austin! Queso still isn't as good as Texas (lacking spice and complexity) but the guacamole and puffy tacos were delicious!
author: Sara S.

description:
This place is decorated beautifully and has a nice layout that takes advantage of the space.
Large windows at the bar give you a view of the local nightlife the mission has to offer. 
A good blend of music plays strong in the background of this dimly lit popular destination. 
The food is presented in a beautiful fashion that utilizes the lighting and method of serving. Whether a cast iron skillet or a green plate. 
The food smells wonderful but the flavors are light and need a little punch or kick to help it over the hump. 
The carnitas has good flavor but crossed the line of crispy to over cooked and burned. 
The green Chile mac and cheese has no spice and the cheese flavor was light. Also the breadcrumbs were a little burnt.
author: Franklin L.

description:
Taco Tuesdays are great here. You can get singular tacos and try different fillings. The margaritas are also reasonable. 

Overall great pick for a Tuesday evening.
author: Aryan C.

description:
Great food. Me and my husband went down there today, we both are foodies and we love going out, eating out and trying new cuisines. 
We've been to different restaurants around the country and abroad, and today was our first time at West of Pecos in San Francisco. We ordered shrimp fajita, queso w/ chorizo, duck tacos, and the impossible vegan tacos! Excellent food! 

Service was great too! The server was very accommodating and not more than 20 minutes, food was then served quickly, and that was an important part for me as a foodie whenever I eat out. Kudos.
author: Betsy Mae C.

description: I had the fried chicken sandwich and The big Bloody Mary !! So good !!!! I was walking by and from the outside it looked really nice inside . I'm glad I stopped in !!
author: George M.

description: My boyfriend and I went to West of Pecos for brunch on a weekend and we had a pleasant, quiet brunch. They serve Mexican cuisine slightly upscale. They have many options and we decided to try the taco bowl and the scrambled eggs. They gave us complimentary chips and salsa which filled our stomach so we ordered very little as man course. Their service is good and well designed interiors. Good place for a hangout to grab some drinks. They have a bar side as well.
author: Julia J.

description: Fun Tex-Mex menu with a variety of meat and vegetarian dishes, high quality food and drinks - surprising given the big portions, friendly service, great biscuits, guacamole, fries. We also really enjoyed the fried chicken sandwich and Impossible burger. The only nit I could mention would be the mixed greens salad was drenched in vinaigrette but the salad itself was better and bigger than expected anyway. We can't wait to go back.
author: Mike H.

description: Wow I've been to the mission a million times and never even knew this place existed. There is ample seating and fun decor. Walked in a Saturday at 6:30pm and got seated right away. Loved the summer squash enchilada which was drenched in sauce, minced tomatoes, and soft garlic pieces. I shared this dish with a friend and we were quickly filled. Flavors were dynamic, cheese in the enchilada was chewy and delicious. Could have used more squash though. Beans were okay (not refried) and rice was okay (dry and lightly flavored). I probably shouldn't have added that to the order (+$3) as I was more than full with my half portion of enchilada. The queso deluxe was thick but a little too rich and sweet for me. Overall a pleasant experience with relatively fast and good service. Felt a bit rushed to leave though as they wanted to take all the plates off at once (was working on cleaning the queso plate!).
author: Lydia Z.

description:
I'm from Texas and am really picky about what gets called Tex Mex- so here I am to tell you, that if you want the cheesy, flavorful, spicy and delicious flavor that is Tex Mex; then head on over to West Of Pecos!

Even when there is a wait, there is usually a spot in the bar area. Taco Tuesday is the best time to go because they have crispy shelled tacos for $3. The beef and queso one was perfect. The chips and guacamole are sooooo good too- they put corn and tomatoes in it. 

If they had a slightly bigger menu, I would give them 5 stars for sure!! It just always feels a little limited. Great spot in the mission- GO!
author: Lauren C.

description: This place is fantastic!!! They have very delicious vegan options and they have food for the meat lovers too.  I love places where everyone can eat happily. The service is impeccable and the drinks yummy.  I need to come here more often. Yum!
author: Sarai T.

description: Amazing queso!  Have had Texan-friends tell me it's the best they've had outside of Texas. Great drinks, great service, love it all, and I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican food usually.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Cute place and reviews about the food were pretty accurate, however the service on the day we went will keep me away. Slow, slow, slow. Had to wait for menus, wait for server to take out orders, forgot my daughter's beverage until we asked for it, had to request water, the check, and even with cash out, the server dropped off the check and left the table...waited another 5 minutes to find someone to take my cash...  Miserable service deserving of a miserable tip. Very friendly, but if you can't manage a couple of tables in a restaurant 2/3 empty, that's a big problem. 
Work on efficient service--there are far too many good restaurants in the area to rest on your laurels.
author: Carrie C.

description:
West of Pecos is a great little Tex mex style spot on Valencia. I've visited a couple of times, and I've generally enjoyed most of the food and drinks I've tried. The prickly pear margarita is sweet and refreshing, and I really like the la flama verde margarita as well if you are feeling something spicy. The queso is an absolute must (although I get it without chorizo). 

Entree wise, my favorite is the puffy impossible taco. It's flavorful and unique with a tasty doughy base. I didn't really enjoy the enchiladas I had last time, it seemed that they were missing some flavor and lacking the unique tastes that define this sort of southwestern cuisine. 

Service is generally decent, although once we had to wait over 30 minutes for someone to come take our order, and the server seemed really low energy and unhappy to be there. Another time, our server was friendly, attentive, and kept our chips refilled the entire time. So it can be a hit or a miss, but it seems that most employees are nice. The ambience is fun and cute, decorated in a southwestern style but still classy, and its not overly loud. I like that they take reservations, and I enjoy most of the food. I'll definitely return!
author: Ayushi A.

description: Had their vegan breakfast bowl, but added grilled chicken breast.  Amazing meal!!! So delicious and flavorful!  Great service as well, but food was just outstanding.
author: Pavel P.

description:
Terrible service. I will never return to this place and do not recommned it for anyone. I have never seen such a rude insesible woman serving tables in U.S. before. 
They count gow manyeals you order even if you already haf lots of food in happy hour menu. They did not bring us napikins even after asking 3 times. I stand up to pic napkims myself, a women came and game me 6, but we were in 12 at the table. I told her I needed more and she not gave me, she told she would come to our table and bring more what she never did. They also restricted payment for 2 credit cards only.
author: Lais F.

description:
Went back for brunch this weekend.  A way better experience than I had experienced here the last time.  Perhaps because it was close to when they had opened and there wasn't a lot of customers, but the food was so completely delicious and filling, it was amazing.  Service was better, although there were several times I wish I could've just refilled my beverages myself.  Overall, maybe brunch is really where it's at.  I wish I was a bloody mary person because they sound amazing, but I just stuck with a margarita and definitely wasn't disappointed.

Overall, I'm definitely more likely to return now.  The experience was way better than my first time, and while it wasn't perfect, it's for sure is better than what I had experienced before.
author: Jes G.

description: Love this place! Food, service and atmosphere are great! Make sure to try the ceviche, tacos, and crab guacamole!
author: Jennifer V.

description: it was Tuesday and we felt like Tacos, we ended up coming here even though we didn't get tacos ;) We ordered the taco salad and the enchiladas which were both delicious. Ours house margarita was spot on . We were able to make same day reservations even though , since it was Tuesday there were plenty of seats available
author: Anju J.

description:
Went to Valencia this morning trying to find a good place for brunch.. went to a couple of places and they were all a 1.5hr wait.. West of Pecos was our 3rd try at getting some food and did not disappoint. Luckily they were able to sit us right away! The place is super cute. Service was great, and the food.. DELICIOUS!! I ordered they're vegan
Bowl and michelada verde.. both the food and drinks were really good. Everything was well
Seasoned and tasted so fresh with so much flavor. Will definitely come back to try their chicken and churros! Lol
author: Aide S.

description:
We wandered by this spot in hopes of finding somewhere to eat and they were able to seat us at 7:00pm on a Saturday with no wait!

This place is pretty cute/fun.  I love the amount of wooden decor and the mexican cantina lights that dangle through the restaurant.  

To start we ordered the red/green salsa with chips which is $2.  I feel like chips and salsa should be free at a restaurant...but I guess $2 isn't that much.  

I ordered the ceviche and yum!  It was so good.  It comes in a huge goblet and it's mixed with avocado, onions, and lime.  It also comes with yucca chips, which are seasoned and delicious!  I loved this dish -- it's super fresh and full of citrus.  

I also got a michelada, which was super cute and delicious (it's beer with lime/salt and some spices)  Super cute and great for IG.  I will definitely return here when I'm in the neighborhood.  Yum!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Being from Texas........queso get a mild ok even with everything in it-it's way overpriced. prickly pecos spicy margarita get a thumbs up but would like it spicier and less ice-it was full of ice. It's also overpriced. House margarita wasn't bad.
Hands down best duck taco-the others were so so.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I checked out West of Pecos for an early dinner on a Saturday evening. 
The decor of the bar and restaurant are really fun and give the place a southwestern vibe. 

I tried the frozen margarita sangria mixed drink and it was really tasty. For dinner we tried the enchiladas and fried chicken plate. The food was subpar - the chicken on the fried chicken plate was covered in a layer of fat and it was obvious that the chicken fat had not been cleaned off the chicken before it was cooked. 

The enchiladas were overpowered by too much sauce that was runny. The chicken inside the enchiladas was mashed which was okay. Overall the food was not good and the reason for my three star review. If they improved their food I would return. Otherwise I would only come back for their drinks.
author: Asha S.

description: I don't like chips and salsa so disgusting and beers  feel like drinking  water :( I don't like this place....
author: Ozan U.

description:
Love this place!

First, the decor is spot on, everything from the chili lights to the wooden interior to the rattlesnake skin in the bathroom.

2nd, the drinks are insanely good! In particular, the roadrunner is my personal favorite. Mezal based, lots of flavors and aromas, and seasoned with some smoked salt which is amazing!

3rd, the food tastes good! The puffy tacos with carne asada and the cornbread skillet are some of my favorites. The guac is also great!

This place is a great casual place for small and large groups, they have a happy hour and good service.

Would definitely recommend and it's one of my go-tos if friends are visiting and I'm in the mission for drinks or food.
author: Mike L.

description:
Last week, we were told we'd have to wait 45 minutes for brunch at Mission Beach Cafe. Brunch in San Francisco. What a scene. I don't care though. I'm getting brunch no matter what on the weekends. It combines two out of my three favorite meals and has been known to come with bottomless champagne. It's not wrong. 

Feeling as though standing outside Mission Beach Cafe for 45 minutes might cause me to implode with hanger, we went looking for a place to have a quick drink and stumbled upon West of Pecos. I ordered your standard mimosa, and it was anything but. The orange juice was fresh and delicious, and you could squeeze two drinks out of one order, as they give you the little bottle of champagne along with their own little bottle of orange juice. 

We were so impressed we decided to come the next week for actual brunch. I ordered the breakfast tostada bowl with bacon. My friend ordered the chile rellenos Benedict with pork belly and a puffy squash taco. 

I'm going to need to come back and just get tacos, because that taco was out of control good. My dish was lovely and, although it had the potential to be heavy, had a nice combination of delicious, light ingredients. Oh yeah, and you can eat the bowl of fried flour tortilla goodness. The Benedict was good too, but I think it would have worked better with sausage. The presentation of both dishes was lovely and colorful. 

You're going to want to order their signature prickly pear margaritas. They're pink. Delicious. $44 a pitcher. You can get about 3 each from the pitcher. Yummmmm! 

Drawbacks? They're newer, and the service is a little slow. It's starting to catch on as a good brunch spot, so get there early and now before they start with the ubiquitous 45 minute brunch waiting time. Over all, very good. A strong brunch contender!
author: Sunny S.

description:
This place is AWESOME. Let's break it down. 

DRINKS
-We got the pitcher of margaritas, which was worth the price if you're 100% you will love the flavor. Ours was delicious so we were happy. It ended up serving about 7 small glasses. 

FOOD
-Holy shit order the "Crispy Maple Brussels Sprouts." Those were some of the most delicious I've ever had. 
-Avoid the "Street Cart Corn" - it was still on the cob so you either get corn stuck in your teeth or you try to cut the kernels off the small slippery pieces. 
-The "Christmas Butternut Squash Enchiladas" were very good!
-We loved the "Crispy Carnitas Puffy Taco." The meat was literally addicting and we have no idea why it was so amazing but totally recommend. 
-"Burrata and Fried Green Tomato Salad" - there was less burrata than I thought, and the fried green tomatoes were pretty sweet. This was good but I don't think I would order again necessarily. 

SERVICE
-The wait was about a half hour. Came on a Saturday night with no reservation at 9pm. 

We sat at the window, which is wide and open to passerbys. It was fun to people watch, and everyone would come up and ask what we were eating. Overall fun vibe and yummy food.
author: Alex R.

description: I love to come here as a great meet up for BumbleBFF events! It's a great place to bring new people and meet even more people! It has great vibes!
author: Kayla C.

description: Food was good and so was the service! I wish the house margaritas were stronger but they did taste well! I did order the house though - so I get what I paid for! Definitely would go back
author: J L.

description: Love love love this place. Mission really is famous for its great restaurant selection, this place hits the spot. Delicious food, welcoming staff and super cozy outdoor tables!
author: Alina S.

description:
This place is totally growing on me and their brunch is tasty and reasonably priced. The queso dip is probably the best I've ever had and I've been dreaming about it since we went on Mother's Day. Our waitress was super sweet and funny and my mom couldn't wipe the smile off her face. It was so cute seeing her enjoy everything and honestly, she's still talking about about it. 

I had the breakfast bowl and it had eggs (over easy), potatoes, pico de gallo, cojita, and pickled onions. Oh and a side of perfectly crisp bacon (it was cold and I know restaurants often pre-cook bacon because it saves time, and I honestly don't even care. It was that good). The only thing missing was black beans. That would have made the dish less dry because of the potatoes. Other than that, it was perfect and the salsa verde served with it was a nice touch. Oh and they let you mix your own mimosas which I love!

Can't wait to come back for brunch and/or dinner ASAP!
author: Steph L.

description:
This is a great sit down dinner place. I went around 730pm on a Saturday night and was told that the wait for 2 would be 45 minutes. However, my boyfriend and I were able to get seats at the bar within 5 minutes. 

The house margaritas were made perfectly. We ordered the chips with salsa (only $2) which were a nice light app. For entrees we got the chicken fajitas and fish tacos. The fajitas were fresh and delicious.  The fish tacos were battered (which I usually don't prefer) but these were lightly battered with a hefty portion of fish. I would highly recommend both. West of Pecos is a great spot for food, drinks or both!
author: Anne K.

description: I'm a noe valley family guy. Been here for 18 years.  This place should pack its bags.  Take its millennial attitude meets Cheesecake Factory to Walnut Creek.  Rude, overpriced and awful people.  I came in with a friend from college-- I will never go again.
author: David G.

description: the food is delicious and it's my first time to have puffy tacos but the environment is kinda loud if you want to have a good conversation.
author: Yi M.

description:
Came here a couple weeks ago with my bf and had a decent experience. 

First of all, the service was pretty bad. We waited way too long to order drinks and then when we were seated, the waitress forgot our chips n salsa twice. I don't know if she thought we wanted them with our entree's but it was weird. Even the hostess left us hanging for a solid 5 minutes when we walked in. 

The food was actually really good. I got the puffy tacos which were really good and not too filling. My bf had the enchiladas which he liked. We both had spicy margaritas which we both loved. 

The bar has a TV but some weird movie was playing, why not put a basketball game on? We couldn't even hear the movie since there was no sound.

I like this place and would come again if the service would just get it together!
author: Taylor B.

description: Drinks are pretty interesting here. I don't think I've seen prickly pear margaritas served anywhere else. They're made from an artificial syrup which is disappointing, but the look and taste pretty good. The food is decent: Great tacos and a very good queso burger, although the bread pudding was a bit underwhelming.
author: Abdel H.

description:
Man, I love this place! I walk by all the time and was craving to go and finally made it back last night. There are two things in the menu that are incredible: corn bread skillet with chile infused butter & green chile mac n cheese. These are the two things I will consistently order when I go there and what I crave. I need to learn how to make this cornbread!! I absolutely love it. 

Other notes about the restaurant, the ambiance is really good. It is happening, good music, loud but not too loud, and is pretty busy but you can walk in on a weeknight. My only qualms about it is that it's a bit pricey for what it is, not upscale Tex-Mex food, decent (not exceptional) service, not tremendously unique but I applaud there efforts towards providing more vegan and plant-based dishes. Still this is a great place especially if you are a bit peckish and looking for a cocktail and a snack, craving Tex-Mex food, or have a big party where ambiance is just as important as the food!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Best guacamole and chips in town! Great service and kid friendly restaurant. We've been there +20 times and have never disappointed. Just order the chips with guacamole for starters and your good. 

Tip: the chopped harvest salad is a really tasty, healthy option if you're not feeling like tacos today but the group wants to go. 

Tip2: Their margaritas...
author: Almgren P.

description: One of my favorite places in San Francisco! The food was delicious and authentic and they had such a fun night-life atmosphere! Had some Mexican beer, split a great salad, and devoured some enchiladas and fish tacos. They have a bar area with some higher tables as well as regular tables and booths throughout the restaurant. The entire place flows really nicely and feels well designed and not tacky. Great experience, I definitely recommend!
author: Morgan C.

description: Love the vegetarian options here!! I usually get a vegetarian grilled plate and they rotate the options seasonally. Yesterday I had a delicious battered & stuffed chile rilleno served with green rice, black beans, and creamed corn. My husband and I always get the crispy brussel sprouts and Mexican street corn to share. He loves the puffy tacos. Yesterday I tried their puffy taco with the Impossible Meat (vegetarian) and it really did taste like meat and bled like meat too!
author: Justin W.

description: Fun happy hour spot from 5PM-6:30PM. I don't care much for alcohol, but they have a decent HH food menu. They have several tacos for $3 each - personal favorite was their pork and green chile one. I also tried their queso ($9) and guacamole ($8). Wouldn't go out of my way to eat it again, but the never ending chips made it great to split with a group. Three tacos later I left feeling stuffed and happy :) great place to go to with a bunch of friends after work.
author: Christine L.

description: West of Pecos is quite an experience, the staff is so friendly and the restaurant is so thoughtfully decorated, I really enjoyed the brisket tacos on the happy hour menu, the drinks are well executed and the hint of smokiness given to the salt on the rim of the margarita is great. It is my favorite flavor combo on any margarita in the city.
author: August S.

description: Food was good and came out quickly but service was lacking. It took us 2 hours for our meal which was mostly waiting on the server to take our order and give us the check.
author: Ana G.

description:
Oof. As my husband said at the end of our meal, "that was a two going on four, if, well, you know..." 

Our experience at West of Pecos was not great. In fact, it was rather disappointing. We came in on a Thursday, and while it seemed pretty full, we were seated immediately. We were looking for a lowkey, fun date night spot, but as we were getting seated, I worried out loud if perhaps this was not the vibe we were looking for. The restaurant has a (barely) more upscale Chevy's vibe, complete with the table of women next to us getting drunk on margaritas and a table of screaming children and apathetic parents on our other side. Mind you, I completely understand that it's out of the restaurant's hands how people choose to behave themselves. However, it definitely didn't help. 

Our server was friendly and answered a few questions that we had about the menu. We figured out what we wanted to order fairly quickly: 
- Queso deluxe: chorizo, guac, sour cream and corn atop a large skillet of queso. Probably my favorite dish, but chips were only ok. 
- Campfire cornbread skillet: pretty straightforward and tasty
- Squash blossom puffy taco: by far my least favorite item that we ordered. All you could taste was fried-ness. All of the other flavors (goat cheese, black beans, romesco sauce) were completely hidden. I took one bite and was done. 
- Dungeness crab enchilada: This dish was fine; portion of crab was generous but the dish was a little all over the place in terms of taste. 

I also ordered the green michelada which just tasted like celery juice with a splash of beer. Definitely not great, but I was warned that it was far different from a traditional michelada. My husband got a mezcal cocktail and enjoyed it. 

We asked for hot sauce twice during our meal, and our server completely forgot to order it. We had also ordered a side of rice and beans, which never came. It ended up being fine because I got pretty full on the chips and queso alone. The food was super heavy and definitely was not a great date night choice. I could see this place being fun if you only plan on getting drinks and some appetizers. Otherwise, I'm sticking with traditional Mexican food from now on.
author: Regina L.

description: One of the best restaurants in San Fran! Literally the best artichoke, Brussel sprouts and chile reillano I've ever had (most likely spelled that wrong but it's ok). Wait staff was superb- and even the manager came over and made sure everything was ok! If you come and don't get the Brussel sprouts then you're doing it wrong. Come here! Also recommend the pitcher of marg.
author: Erica E.

description: We had the puffy tacos, queso, and mac and cheese.  Nothing stood out.  The tacos were soggy and very salty.  I could only finish two bites of the Mac and Cheese.  Tasted like chemicals.  Extremely disappointing.  And the service was poor.  There were several groups waiting to be seated while the hostess was chatting with friends for about eight minutes before wandering our way.  Not sure why this place gets traffic, especially since the food is double the price of surrounding restaurants and not tasty.
author: sarah h.

description: The chopped harvest salad is the best salad I've ever had in my life. Added bonus for the goblets of beer. Does anyone know if the green goddess dressing is for sale?????????
author: Rachel J.

description: Fabulous meal. Interesting flavors! Enchiladas with crab were original, super tasty and served and cute skillet. Lots of vegetarian options. Service was prompt and friendly! Apart from the deserts we thought the prices were reasonable (if you're familiar with SF prices though - if you're a tourist and reading this sorry it will still be expensive). The setting is pretty cool. Quite loud but not in an unpleasant way...
author: Anne M.

description: The food was so yummy but the server was the worst I've ever encountered. We went on a weeknight at the restaurant was not busy at all but our server hardly came to the table. She told us that she wouldn't give us more chips because we need to wait for our dinner. She also didn't order our appetizer and when we asked her about it she definitely went to the kitchen and it looked like she blamed the kitchen. Bad service
author: Sierra R.

description:
Wait - Walk-in 13:00 (brunch) on Saturday. No wait.

Value - $14 / dish. Great value.

Dish Size: Large servings enough for 2 meals.

Queso & Chips - We came simply in search of good queso in SF and was not disappointed. 

Fried Chicken and Churros - First impression - I think I have at least half a chicken worth of food on my plate. The fried chicken is decent and I wish the skin was crispier. The churros are on point, much better than the $6.50 ones you get at the ball park. 

Coffee Rubbed Brisket Hash - Out of the two entrees, the brisket hash was the superior dish. The brisket pieces are huge and tender and the tomatillo salsa definitely gives the dish the Tex-Mex flair. 


The main reason we even tried West of Pecos was to find a place that served queso. We were on a mission, and could care less about the other dishes the restaurant had to offer. We arrived at a surprisingly large restaurant, in the heart of the Mission, with Tex-Mex flair decorated from head to toe. The interior tries to transport you to what I can only imagine what El Paso looks like. With roasted chili peppers lamps hanging from the ceiling and rattlesnake skins framed in the bathroom, it almost borderline became kitsch. 

West of Pecos is one of the restaurants where you go for a particular dish - and that particular dish is the queso. The other dishes fall in that indistinguishable range of "not that bad and not that good." Since the portions are so large, almost two meals for the price one, and the food is not entirely unpalatable, West of Pecos should be considered if you're looking for an above average Tex-Mex restaurant.
author: Julian L.

description: We come here all the time for the impossible burger. The people are friendly, service is quick, location is hopping and the vibes are great for dinner lunch or boozy brunch.
author: Art K.

description:
Love the concept and the queso was pretty good (chorizo seemed unneeded though). I'd get it without the jalapenos next time too. It wasn't as good as the queso from Tacolicious but I would still order it again.

The breakfast tostada bowl was baffling. Very hard to eat, they included pico de gallo even though I asked without it, the potatoes had literally no flavor, the guacamole was UNDER the tostada bowl thing which made it both hard to eat it and also the shell soggy.  And the pork belly was hands down the worst pork belly I have ever had- almost inedible. I appreciate that it included quite a bit of pork belly for just $2 but it was so terrible and dry and I ended up not eating most of it.
  
I'm sure this place has better food but the tostada bowl I had was somewhere between 1 and 2 stars and since the queso was probably around 4, i give them 3 for now. I wouldn't be in a rush to come back here, though I would consider coming back to try some of their other menu options.
author: Seema U.

description: This is my husband's and my go-to for a snack hour/HH. The workers are awesome - particularly the usual bartender - we love him! So friendly, very attentive. The snack hour is a great deal - we LOVE the guac (real avo, none of that filler crap or watery) and the tacos are great - we love the crispy honey duck taco and black bean taco. So yummy!
author: Rachael S.

description:
Y'all... the QUESO NACHOS. I am dead. I don't think I've ever had queso like this in my life. And with chorizo?? Shut the front door. It was so good that I made sure the tacos I ordered also had queso on it. In all honesty, the queso nachos were so stellar that the tacos seemed like the stepsister of the night. That being said, the tacos were super flavorful (make sure you get two-three of them). 

Go for the happy hour! $3 tacos with awesome margaritas is a win-win in my book. Would definitely come back. Plus, our server took such good care of us all night!
author: Shelby S.

description: Tasty carnitas puff tacos, and the house margarita was delicious. Only complaint is that every time I've made a reservation, I still have to wait about ten minutes for my table
author: Erica Z.

description: We love the puffy tacos at West of Pecos amongst other items. We have gone there several times and always walked out happy. My wife surprised me for my birthday and arranged for my friends to be there. Our waitress was amazing and went above and beyond to make the evening great!
author: Theodore S.

description: West of Pecos is now even better! They added a ton of vegan options including the impossible burger with cashew cream
author: Sheel M.

description:
Man, the Mission has changed soooo much since I used to stumble around drunk with friends in my twenties. I have absolutely no clue when this restaurant opened, but I went there with a date tonight and I really enjoyed it! We ordered the queso to start, which is a MASSIVE quantity of cheese dip served in a little iron skillet (the part of me that misses Texas LOVED that detail). This is enough for three people, and verging on too much for two. They'll bring out plenty of chips-- we must've had at least three baskets between us, and there was STILL queso left when our entrées came.

I ordered the vegetarian chili relleno, which had a delightfully crispy coating and was served with salsa, whole black beans, rice, and some creamed corn. My only complaint is that the beans were slightly bland, but I mixed the remaining queso with the beans and rice and it was kind of perfect. The servings are extremely generous, and the staff is very polite and helpful. I really liked the dried chili pepper light fixtures and the rest of the decor! I'd totally come back sometime.

P.S. The wait for two on a Saturday evening was about 10-15 minutes.
author: Jessie A.

description: Came in on a Friday night for a casual dinner and the vibe is super fun! I loved the decor and the space. We started off with a pitcher of the in-famous el guapo, I'm not a huge fan of mezcal but I still enjoyed this drink! We got some queso and chips for the table which were just ok and the braised chicken enchiladas were good but nothing to write home about. It is on the pricier side but the perfect pre-blondies dinner spot!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Decided to come here randomly (the sushi place I looked up was not even open, thanks yelp) 

It was a Thursday night, not busy at all to our benefit. We sat outside by the fireplace under a heat lamp that actually worked and kept us so warm! 

The food: AMAZING. Best cornbread I have ever had in my life and I do not like corn bread. I love nachos, these were beyond delicious. The cheese was just perfect. They have impossible meat that was deceivingly delicious! vegans/vegetarians you are set! Everything else was equally delicious, meat was cooked perfectly, seasoning etc 

Overall, stocked I found this place and will definitely be coming back for dinner in SF
author: Stephanie M.

description:
My girlfriend and I have been wanting to come here for some time now. Finally got the chance and went on a Sunday around 6 oclock. I made last second reservations on the app to request a window seat since it was a nice night and is located right on beautiful Valencia street.

We ordered a boozy Cactus Bowl to share which was the perfect amount for two people. For food, I ordered the chicken enchiladas and she ordered two puffy tacos and we shared everything. We also ordered chips and salsa for the table (only $2 lol). We left feeling full and satisfied. Food was really good and I'd definitely come back. I highly recommend the puffy tacos.

Also, it's located right near one of our favorite bars, Giordano Bros. Recommend checking it out!
author: Aaron M.

description:
Crab guac. Need I say more?

This is a fun spot for dinner when you're having a night out with friends. They did take my favorite salad off the menu (R.I.P.), but that just means I have to order puffy tacos instead (nothing to be sad about).
author: Emily F.

description:
3 stars + 1 star for fun atmosphere and good drinks and appetizers. This spot is more western than traditional Mexican. If you're looking for traditional Mexican food go next door to Puerto Alegre. West of Pecos is a great option if you want some southwest style or a good happy hour.

Appetizers - the cornbread, green chili mac & cheese, and queso are all delicious.

Food - I honestly can't remember what we ordered because it was not memorable. 

Drinks - DELICIOUS margaritas and a large selection. 

Vibe - super fun vibe. There is a fairly large bar area where I recommend claiming a (first come first serve) spot.
author: Juliet S.

description:
Hey, I know they are known for their meaty dishes, but lately they've been featuring the Impossible burger on their sandwhich board, so the gf and I finally gave it a try since the vegan sushi place we'd intended to visit had a 2 hour wait.

"What do you have that's vegan?" Our standard question for a place like this.The hostess pointed out a few things, iincluding the Vegan Grill and the hamburger, which for an extra $3 (on top of $15) would be made with the vegan Impossible burger.

So we sit and order that Impossible burger, but you also have to specify that you want it vegan, because it comes with cheese and there is no vegan cheese substitute. 

The burger comes out and now there is no bun as well. Just the burger on a piece of iceberg lettuce and a side of shoestring fries. 18 bucks. Good thing I had leftovers at home, because this wasn't doing it for me.

Clearly this vegan thing is NOT in their wheelhouse. Not sure why they even try if it's going to be this half-assed.

On the good side, the flavors were there, the vegan grill had some nice surprises, like a coconut creamed corn baked in a squash. So it shows promise. Just a bit more effort, a vegan bun, some vegan cheese and they would open themselves up to a whole new crowd.
author: Cory W.

description:
My partner and I were walking on Valencia looking for a place to have Sunday brunch. We passed West of Pecos and took a look at the menu and decided to give it a try. Glad we did. 
I ordered the pork belly breakfast tacos with scrambled eggs and avocado. Wow! Amazing. You get two and homestyle potatoes. I am not a fan of homestyle potatoes but these were really good. I had a mimosa. As far as mimosa's go, it was typical. Service was quick and my waitress gave us recommendations. I think the prices were fair and the food good. 
Overall: Much better than I was expecting. 
High point: Those pork belly breakfast tacos! YUM
Low point: no posole or menudo.
Chances i'll be back: YES! I already am craving those breakfast tacos.
author: Mike Z.

description: Came here with some friends today we were looking for a place just to get some drinks, this place had no wait and and plenty of open tables. We asked the host if it was ok to sit out on the patio she said no we can only have a table if we ordered food, two people in my group said that they were willing to order food even though we weren't to hungry. She then said no everyone in the group must order food so we needed to sit at the bar. Proceeded to the bar I ordered a drink and some how magically we were able to sit at a table. With plenty of attitude she then expressed that she was going to transfer my tab to the table which I didn't think was fair for the bartender I ordered from him I should tip him long story short front desk host lady should find another job rather then chasing paying customers away her attitude towards us was completely inappropriate and not deserving we were just trying to have a good time. I'm only giving two stars because our server was awesome, the bartender was awesome, and the food was great. I just felt like someone needs to no about the representation of the restaurant in the beginning
author: David J.

description:
Came here with a couple of friends. Great place for a group. We made a reservation before we came here on a Saturday night, but it seems like it wasn't needed. It wasn't too crowded.

The restaurant has a really nice vibe, and the noise level is just right. Not too loud, not too awkward.

The service was also excellent! The servers checked on us about 4 times throughout the entire dinner.

I got the fish tacos, and they were delicious. They're also pretty big! But apparently, the buttermilk fried chicken was too good, according to my friend.
author: Do P.

description: Had the fried chicken entree with grits, mashed potatoes, and greens on the side--BOMB! I was more drawn to the sides, so tasty; the chicken, while well-breaded, could use a little more taste. Otherwise, great service and food.
author: D D.

description:
My husband and I live nearby and decided to finally check out this place, which seems to always be busy.

There were a couple service snafus. We had a reservation and were immediately seated, but then waited fifteen minutes to get water and menus -- only after we asked the hostess where they were. We ordered drinks, but they didn't end up coming until after our meal arrived.

The food was also pretty bad. I had an Impossible (meatless) burger, and it was very dry. The whole point of this burger is that it's supposed to be juicy, unlike other vegetarian/vegan burgers, and this was the opposite of that. The burger came with fries that were ok, if a little salty.

My husband had carnitas and breaded beef tacos, and in both dishes the meat was overcooked and dry.

On the positive side, I had a mezcal cocktail, which was really good!

Overall, you can get a better $30 meal at many other restaurants on Valencia Street. Go to one of them.
author: Anita J.

description:
West of Pecos has a sumptuous brunch menu, from light fresh ceviche, traditional egg options and a broad range of Tex Mex favorites with Tyler's unique twist.
The staff are friendly and attentive without being overwhelming or pushy.
Great atmosphere, would give six stars if I could.
author: B F.

description:
I ordered the Chicken and Churros for brunch with a side of chips and guacamole. The guacamole and chips were delicious with good chunks of avocado and jalapeños (not spicy).

The Chicken and Churros were absolutely delicious. The Chicken was fried with a somewhat sweet taste which complemented the Churros perfectly. Great food! They gave me three Churros and 3 drumsticks with a large chicken breast. Had leftovers, could have shared for sure!
author: Naeemah C.

description:
A friend local to the Mission recommended West of Pecos when we heard it would be a 2 hour wait for another restaurant we wanted to try. His description of the restaurant of "TexMex with good margaritas" was pretty spot on. 

This is a great spot for a dinner with friends over a pitcher of margaritas and some texmex. The portions are pretty large and the food is heavy, so make sure to come hungry! We ordered a few different things and were so full, we had to take 3 boxes of leftovers.

Of everything we ordered, our favorites were:
- Queso (BOMBbbb)
- Brussel sprouts 
- Fried Chicken (comes with mashed potato, sauteed spinach and grits)
author: Estelle C.

description: Wow! Loved the cocktails, atmosphere and food. All in all great experience. Service was a little slow because of how busy it was, but that's understandable. Definitely will come back again!
author: Deidre L.

description: Tasty food and attentive wait staff. Fried chicken needed salt. Fajitas were a little bland.
author: Paul Andrew C.

description:
My daughter is a regular here for Brunch and has raved about it for awhile...

I must say it is rave worthy.  Cool Decor, fantastic service, the food was delicious.  Carnitas Taco was perfection.

My daughter had several special requests and was accommodated without complaint.

Try it, you'll like it!
author: Alohaono D.

description: Great spot in Mission. Good Tex mex food and nice staff. Definitely recommend. Their cornbread and chili butter is the best ever! Great for brunch and lunch, I have not tried them for dinner yet.
author: Gabriel S.

description: Bring salt. And lowered expectations. Went on a Tuesday night and even with the restaurant half empty, we still received shitty service. For all my fellow POC: this place was so bland and overrated, once I left the restaurant it turned me into a white girl with the sole mission of posting a scathing review on Yelp. Support non-hipsterdized, long term Mission establishments and spend ur hard earned pennies at Puerto Alegre right next door.
author: Hell G.

description:
Much yum! So wow! 

Literally everything I've tried on their menu is out of this world good. I'll keep coming back so that I can make sure to eat everything on the menu at least once. Definitely recommend!!
author: Ronke A.

description: I dunno. Came here on a taco Tuesday. It was bland. Also the restaurant smelled like a urinal cake....so yeahhhhh.
author: Kaizer D.

description:
Came here on Friday night and this place was packed! Checked in and the host said it would be 40 mins but it only ended up the be 15 mins wait. We ordered the bbq brisket and carnitas puffy tacos, the flavors were great, it's served on a hot flat bread and the meat was tender. We also got the cornbread, which was buttery, served on a skillet. The buttermilk fried chicken was also very good and was served with this cheesy corn, spinach and potatoes. 

I would definitely come back again for more puffy tacos and margaritas.
author: Jennifer K.

description: I love this place! It's Great to stop by for appetizers and a cocktail, or bring your whole dinner party here. I came here for my birthday with a party of four. The service was excellent, the staff was very nice and attentive. The food came quickly, and the quality was amazing. Drinks were great too! In my defense I love Tex-Mex food, but this place takes it to the next level. I just can't say enough good stuff about West of Pecos! I can't wait to go back!
author: Paula R.

description:
As a West Texan ex-pat living in the Bay Area, I was conflicted about checking out West of Pecos. In the four years I've lived in Berkeley every "Tex-Mex" place that I have tried here has been a disappointing simulacrum of the real thing. I had no expectations that West of Texas would be any better than those places. Nevertheless, even the most remote possibility of a wonderful Tex-Mex meal was enough to entice me to give this place a try. 

When I think of food west of Pecos, I picture: warm, crispy tortilla chips served with spicy salsa, refreshing margaritas with fresh lime juice, a (visibly and audibly) sizzling skillet with well-seasoned fajita meat, grilled onions and peppers, refried beans, rice, and sweet puffy sopapillas with honey. Sounds amazing right? In fact, you are probably looking at flights to El Paso after reading this. Anyway, the SF West of Pecos, wasn't able to live up to those lofty standards. However, their attempt at Southwestern cooking is nothing to scoff at.

My girlfriend and I arrived at the restaurant around 6 pm on a Friday night. The place was packed, so we put our names on the waiting list. I like that they take your phone number and text you when your table is ready. After a 15 minute wait at the bar, we were seated.

I was excited to see that West of Pecos carries Shiner Bock, a beer that is a staple of any decent establishment. We each ordered a bottle ($4) as well as chips and guacamole ($10). 
That's a pretty high price for guac considering that the portion was deceptively small. They stacked chips under the serving bowl, so it would seem like there was more guac than there actually was. What seemed like a deep bowl, was actually a shallow dish. In terms of taste, the guac was fine, but nothing special.

I should note that they do not offer complimentary chips and salsa, which is a crime in most parts of Texas. They also up-charge for beans and rice for entrees which is also illegal throughout the state. I'm being facetious, but seriously, your restaurant wouldn't last longer than a month in Texas if you did either of these things. 

Fortunately, the main dishes really redeemed the restaurant. I ordered the flank steak fajitas ($21), and while my skillet was not sizzling as it was brought to me (it's a simple trick to do; just Google it) the steak was nicely seasoned, and the array a sauteed peppers and onions was exceptionally tasty. I liked the corn tortillas too. Overall, it was a satisfying fajita plate. 

My girlfriend ordered the Hatch green chile burger with bacon ($15). The burger was juicy and cooked perfectly. The Hatch peppers had a nice smoky taste, but didn't bring any noticeable amount of heat to the burger. That's a shame, because it would have been balanced well by the rich garlic mayo sauce. The fries, which were more of potato wedges, were just fine. 

Our service was good up until we had finished our meal. After that our server disappeared for a while, and we waited about 20 minutes before receiving the check. She seemed to be cognizant of this though, and she surprised us by comping our beers, which was really nice of her to do. 

In the end, I was actually pretty impressed with the food and service at West of Pecos. It's not on the level of the food back home, but it is definitely the best Tex-Mex that I have had in the Bay.
author: Ravi S.

description:
Queso. BEST QUESO IN SF. It's perfectly balanced with "real" and "fake" cheese... what I mean is it's gooey yet fresh... What I mean is it's  perfect for scooping with the legit chips they serve with it. Just order it and thank me later.

Guacamole is chunky and fresh and really tasty.

They have GREEN MICHELADAS. Hi hello it's me. I love them so much! 

Every food item on the menu is good so you really can't go wrong.

I love the happy hour. It's one of the best deals in town when it comes to the food part. 

The bar has a tv and is perfect for any Giants game watching.

When you're there say hi to owner Tyler, he always in the restaurant and is one of the coolest/ most interesting/ nicest people in town. His red hair is hard to miss - just as  as his awesome restaurant.
author: Taylor S.

description: I miss Tex-mex from back at home in Houston so I decided to give this place a try. It's pretty pricy and I would say it has more of a modern twist compared to the Tex-mex places in Texas. I feel like the menu should offer more but I am only giving this restaurant 4 stars because I really (and only) enjoyed the puffy taco with crispy carnitas! I will only come back for this and it is a great and creative combo. The puffy taco and sweet carnitas make a perfect combination.
author: Kaylee V.

description:
First of all I would like to say that I have been a customer of West of Pecos for over 2 years, when we lived in the mission my boyfriend and I went there every weekend and occasional dinners. Hey have amazing drinks and food, especially michelada's mix that they make in house.

The reason to give this place a 1 star is because they hate DOGS.  My boyfriend and I were kicked from just sitting outside with my little, precious Frenchie Sputnik.  Any place that hates animals should be boycotted! Shame on you and your manager.  People are rude and stuff is horrible.
author: Christina Z.

description: Love this place!  Service is great- everyone was friendly. Highly recommend the Fish tacos and a Bloody Mary to go with it for brunch!  Edgar the bartender makes great drinks. We went on a Saturday around noon and there was no wait.
author: Judy K.

description: I don't normally review places immediately after eating at them, but this place was a huge letdown. I appreciated the fact that they offered a vegan option "seasonal vegan plate" but it was not very creative, and the only part of it that was creative was gross (broccoli). The dish was comprised of plain black beans, plain green rice, plain grilled corn on the cob, and broccoli with super odd and confusing flavors. The guacamole was very disappointing too. I actually feel queasy after eating here and would not recommend it to my friends....it's also OVERPRICED.
author: Christina M.

description:
This review is not about West of Pecos. This review is about queso. 

No, not queso fresco. QUESO. That silky-smooth, cheesy, drippy, spicy, addictive mainstay of every Mexican and Tex-Mex menu in Southeast. A delectable national treasure that, upon moving to San Francisco, I was appalled to learn is apparently not so national after all.

From the Mission to the Marina, I couldn't find good queso. I could not find it in a bar. I could not find it in a jar. I could not find it here or there. I couldn't find it anywhere.

Enter West of Pecos. Not only do they actually HAVE queso, but it is smooth, drippy queso. It is spicy queso. It is addictive queso. This queso tastes like home. And the prickly pear margarita was good to boot.

Thank you, West of Pecos for satiating my queso-loving heart (and tastebuds) at last.
author: Sara F.

description:
How West of Pecos' Made Us Happy:

1) Spacious bar area and a cool, Western vibe.

2) Great $2.50 Happy Hour tacos! The Honey Duck was the fave and the Black Bean one was surprisingly good also.

3) Hawt housemade habenero sauce for Hubby.

4) Damn good guacamole. Loads of avocado with bits of corn and tomato in the mix. (If only there were loads of garlic too...)

5) Churrrrros! The chocolate and cajeta sauces were knife-lickingly good.*** The churros to sauce ratio was off though as the three churros were kind of small and doughy in the middle. 

***http://i.imgur.com/orcjW7P.png
author: Amy C.

description:
I only dropped by for HH but it's definitely a spot I'd like to return for dinner. 

+ HH Food (5pm-6:30pm): great taco choices, I particularly enjoyed the brisket and honey duck ones. Habanero wings were a bit too smoky spicy for me. Guacamole and chips were delish! Queso and chorizo was another great choice as well. We ordered the puffy tacos (not on HH menu but a mere $5/each). I didn't like the puffy tacos because it was a bit thick and doughy. Margaritas & sangria were both pretty solid. Very reasonable prices.

+ Ambiance: I love the decor (chili hanging from the ceiling) and the open, airy space near the bar. We got there right when it opened (at 5pm) and during the 2hrs we stayed, it was busy but not crowded which is always a plus.
author: Ruby C.

description: I'm from Texas so a few of these things for me are a no-go (what is this "queso" ???) but overall I really like this place and the bar is really fun. I'm currently obsessed with the impossible puffy tacos. And the duck taco on happy hour is also soooooo good. Highly recommend.
author: Tara K.

description:
We only had drinks there. The cocktails were great. The bartenders do know their craft. It has good top shelf whiskey collection too. 
It was crowded on a Saturday night but we did find a place to sit pretty soon.
author: Amit K.

description: They caterer to my job like once a month I like it, its one of the best meals we get. The Achiote Rubbed Chicken Thigh is My Fav!!! With the cilantro rice.
author: Mychelle T.

description: Should be called "West of Mocos" Bad service. Hella rude. Hella racist. Over priced food. What do you expect in gentrified mission area.
author: La Chankluda V.

description:
My girlfriend and I had just had a very disappointing meal nearby. Wanting to drink that disappointment away, we stopped by West of Pecos for a round. It was Thursday, January 28th at 8pm. We walked in and sat at a high top in the bar area.
