*La flama verde (spicy): tequila, lime, cucumber, genepy, jalapeno ($11) ×2
*Puebla old fashioned: reposado tequila, ancho reyes chili liqueur, bitters, orange peel, smoked ice ($12) ×2

I got the old fashioned. A fun play on the cocktail, with tequila as the main liquor. I really wanted to try one of their tequila drinks, but I wanted the flavors of something dark and smokey. This did the trick! My gf liked her cocktail as well. I had a sip and while it was light and refreshing, it definitely had a spicy kick!

Since we were taking up a table, we ordered the Queso & chips: house-made chorizo ($10). Cheesy and oh so flavorful! Gooey cheese and chorizo are one of my favorite combinations. This one dish was so much better than the meal we were trying to forget.

My gf and I were having so much fun, we ended up talking and getting two rounds of drinks. I love the vibe of this place. Dark, fun and bustling, but you can still have a conversation and enjoy the company of whoever you are dining with.

Great bar area. If the queso is any indication of their food, I'd love to come back for dinner one day.
author: Elena N.

description:
What's the difference between Cal-Mex & Tex-Mex?

I'm not entirely too certain, but for being a Californian, I actually do like Tex-Mex better. *braces for haters*

I go to Texas most every year and every time I come back to California, I'm disappointed that Tex-Mex is nearly impossible to find around here, and the Cal-Mex is never as good. Come on guys!

So when I saw that there was a Tex-Mex restaurant right here in the heart of the Mission, I knew I had to go.

Arriving the first thing I noticed was the large space and warm atmosphere. Light made of chilies hang from the ceiling. There is a bar area that is more lively to the right, and then more intimate and cozy booths to the left. I sat down and just adored all the artwork and paintings.

As for the menu, only 2/6 of the menu is food. The rest are drinks! Cocktails on the front, beer on the back, spirits on the 2nd to the last. Food is on the 2&3 page. I can't believe I can drink some good ol Shiner Bock! And it's only $3 during Happy Hour! I will have to come back for that.

I ordered the RoadRunner, which is a Mezcal cocktail. Very smokey with a hint of spice. A great drink to sip on.
As for food, there are a ton of vegetarian options, and vegan food can be made with a bit of modification.
I ordered the taco, without any cheese or cream. It is a crispy taco topped with sauteed mushrooms, beans, and pomegranate. This was really good, though a bit pricey at $5 for 1 taco and no sides or garnishes.
I also ordered the side of Maple roasted Brussel Sprouts. These were my favorite here! Crispy brussel sprouts that is sweet and salty. It is so good to just pop these into your mouth or top my taco with it.

In terms of prices, it is a bit high. $13 and I ate 1 taco and a small plate of brussel sprouts. I was just full enough, but felt like I could've eaten a little more. 
Maybe this place is worth it during Happy Hour.

But the food is well prepared and full of flavor. 

Tex-Mex food at Cali prices. Whodathunk.
author: Lanie L.

description: Pork belly taco was awesome but they can do better by making it crispy rather than chewy.
author: Sonali S.

description:
Great food, mediocre service. It almost seemed as if we were being ignored as we waited for 20 minutes to order watching the staff service other tables. When we ordered the appetizers came about 15 minutes later but we still didn't have our drinks and had to remind the waitress twice.

Disappointing for a good spot.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
First of all, you should take my 5 stars with a grain of salt because I am a total sucker for Western-themed restaurants.

But West of Pecos always impresses me in ways that are totally unnecessary.

My favorite menu item is the cup of goddamn cheese (with chorizo & peppers in it too, chips on the side).  Not enough restaurants have the audacity to just put a cup of goddamn cheese on the menu.

The other day we ordered a side of broccoli just to be a little bit healthy.  And it was delicious!  Why would a restaurant bother to make a side of broccoli taste good?  You know we'll eat it no matter how bad it tastes.  But for some reason, West of Pecos gave us a pretty tasty and interesting side of broccoli.

Also, because it's on Valencia and has a bar and whatnot, and because Yelp says "Good for Kids: No", you'd think this restaurant would not be kid-friendly.  But you would be wrong!  And frankly you should stop being so judgmental.  We come here with kids all the time, there are many kid-friendly menu items, and there's even a changing table!
author: Ian S.

description:
We found this place accidentally, but were attracted by the cozy outside tables and interior. It was a delicious food experience for a reasonable prices. My friend and me ordered a meat mix and enchiladas, which looked and tasted amazing! I was drinking the faith healer cocktail, was very refreshing and now one of my favorite drinks ;)
The waitress was very friendly and brought the food in 10-15 min after were ordered.  
If you are looking for a good food and atmosphere, give a shot to West of Pecos!
author: Mariya O.

description: The menu and space isn't particularly surprising, but everything is always beautifully cooked and delicious. You get the impression the menu has been carefully designed and someone in the kitchen is keeping a close eye on consistency and quality. I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered here. The staff are always super nice and welcoming and you can walk in without a reservation for weekend brunch at 11am and get a table without waiting. The guacamole and corn bread skillet are tops.
author: Ari W.

description: This place is awesome and the vibe is everything. Obviously you could go next door or across the street and get the same food for cheaper but it's totally worth it. They have Impossible meat so it's a great place to bring your vegan friends and the margs are the best!
author: Emily B.

description:
My friend from out of town was visiting and suggested we visit here for Happy hour as it's one of his favourite places to go whenever he is in SF.
We went on Taco Tuesday, which was a surprise as we weren't expecting the prices to be so reasonable. I ordered a handful (5) braised chicken Tacos and we got the queso dip to share.
The queso dip was unbelievably good. The chorizo included was amazing and our server was extremely friendly. The tacos were ok. I wish I had read the they were hard shell tacos and I regret not being more adventurous and choosing different types rather than just the chicken.
author: James A.

description: I dig the smokey spice & saltiness of their signature cocktails. The food's a good example of upscale-bar-friendly white folks "Mexican" food as well.
author: James W.

description:
I was impressed with West of Pecos! No wait even during peak weekend brunch hours, fun and laid-back atmosphere, and delicious, quality food. That's awesome for a bumpin' neighborhood like the Mission.

My friends and I split the guacamole and queso with chips. They dust their chips with paprika or some other spice that makes them awesome, and they're generous with refills. Their queso is the BEST queso I've had outside of Texas (my hometown) in quite some time. 

I ordered fruit and the puffy mushroom & squash taco, which might be seasonal since the online menu had a different variation of this. It was delicious, but a bit on the small side. I think you'd have to order 2-3 puffy tacos to be full.

My friend's kale tostada bowl looked really good and healthy! I would order that next time. 

Service was great and they were quick to refill our beverages. West of Pecos is seriously underrated and I hope it stays that way :)
author: Valerie L.

description: Wow. I had heard that the "new" Valencia was racist but we still decided (based on a friends recommendation) to  come and check it out. Sadly but expected- it's another racist gentrifying restaurant stealing sacred art as a quick trip to a resort. The waitress was so demeaning and blatantly racist. Over and over she would follow and later harassed many of the people in our party. After a complaint to the manager the waitress started again telling us that because we didn't make reservations we couldn't be here. It was not just one waitress. It was several- including the manager. It's incredible how this behavior was tolerated and promoted. After spending at least $300 we left. It was incredible.
author: Solymar S.

description: Went with a group of 8 and there was an issue with almost everyone's food. Wasn't very good but the waiter was nice
author: Jessica N.

description:
So I really enjoyed this spot. Drinks were amazing. I had two El Guapos. Soooo good.

The reason it's four stars is because the service was just a little slow and the ceviche had dairy in it. I wish they said it in the menu. I didn't want to send it back though because it would just get thrown away. :(

I don't consume dairy but I was conflicted between eating it and having it wasted.

I'd go back. I'd just make sure to ask about the ingredients in any dish before I order.
author: Ghia E.

description: Nice environment but food really so-so. I was really disappointed because all of the photos online at Yelp "looked" good. But this is the trend for what I would called "Millenial Food". It''s all about looking good on the outside. The chicken tacos were  terribly dry but very colorful. The salsa they served with the chips was like bad cheese fondue. The best thing about this place was the theme and the large black and white photos of cowboys. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and like the tacos at Taco Bell better ...
author: Wesley W.

description:
They used to have better salsa. The new version? Meh, I could skip it.

Cornbread (served in a little griddle) with honey and buttah? Excelente.

Macaroni and cheez? Good.

Cocktails? Interesting. I usually have wine tho.

Brunch? Had the huevos rancheros. Barely ok. The rice and beans need work.

The sopaipillas? Epic, as in drizzle that honey on that thang and order me seconds, please.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Great Atmosphere and Food!  Margaritas are very solid!
Overall this is a great place to hang out in the bar for drinks and apps or dine in the main restaurant.
author: G R.

description: I have enjoy more than one brunch now at West of the Pecos and there are a number of things I truly enjoy about our visits- the food, the flavors, friendly vibe, pretty good quality ingredients, open and spacious. I have found the service to be a little unreliable and more than often my -special requests- lose their way back to the kitchen, a lot of times I need a no mayo or no cheese plate... Sucks to have them remake the plate cause of my allergies even when they said it was no prob to begin with... But always gets done. Just don't be n a rush here :) fried chicken is phenomenal!
author: Coco J.

description:
This was my first time. Initially the host told us the wait could be 45 minutes, but she texted us in less than 20. We were put on a small table which is was fine but there was a shelf table right next to us that felt really squished. 

The margaritas were amazing! The texture of the Guac was good but lacked flavor. I got fish tacos because i thought that was fool proof, i was wrong. Big, greasy, bland pieces of cod (i think). Black beans were so dry, it was like chewing sand but I liked the rice served with it.  My friends fajitas were good; so after a few margaritas, i'd order that. 

Oh and my friend ordered the fajitas and pointed to the words "chicken fajitas" on the menu as he ordered in the case that the waitress couldn't hear... They tried to give him fried chicken 3x...
author: imaginary s.

description: Best frozen margarita I've had. And strong and too. Food is rich and delicious, although I had the vegan burger. Fries were great too! Would definitely go back. Make reservations far in advance though or be prepared to wait a little.
author: Azi M.

description: Food is pretty bland. Margaritas are good.
author: Logan S.

description: Just moved to the area and absolutely love this restaurant! Cool atmosphere, friendly staff and the food is delicious. I appreciate that they take reservations unlike most the restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Eileen S.

description: Tex mex joint in the mission. Fish tacos are really tasty! Eat them fast though. Much much better when they're hot. Queso is delish. Highly recommend for an app. Atmosphere makes it a fun place to go for date. Dark and candlelit.
author: Abigail S.

description: We absolutely LOVE West of Pacos. Awesome staff, great food and margaritas are to die for. Try the puffy tacos!!!
author: Wade W.

description: Everything was great. Cruised in and we were sat right away. Had some tasty and spicy cocktail that was perfect. Then two tasty enchilada. One veggie and one crab. Both perfect. Already looking forward to going back.
author: Matthew T.

description:
Our server (forgive me if I misspell her name) Kinka was the truth !!!
The food was amazing. I initially reserved for a party of 8 ,invited 11,due scheduling issues we ended up with a party of 3!!! 
We had a ball ! woooooo! We had the pork enchillada, the carnitas,and about 4 other yummy things, awesome !!!
author: Lydia V.

description:
Mmmm! Stopped in for a quick happy hour and the food and drinks were delicious. 

What we had: 
Braised chicken tacos 
Beef sliders
Chips and guacamole 
Queso ** 
Margaritas (blended and very strong!)

Everything was hot, fresh, flavorful and the meat was TENDER. Friendly staff and clean tables.
author: Andreea M.

description:
When my friend suggested West of Pecos for a meal, I was skeptical because I don't really enjoy tex-mex. But I really liked West of Pecos (at least for lunch)! I tried their pork belly tacos which were really good...they're breakfast tacos so there's egg and avocado, but the pork belly is what made it stand out. Such a good alternative to bacon! It seemed so flavourful and when I finished my taco I just wanted to eat more...

I also tried their eggs benedict which was much more normal (not in a bad way, I was just so happy from the tacos). It's your standard eggs benedict that you'd expect from any brunch place. 

Try their house made habanero sauce, it's good!
author: Theresa L.

description:
I'd made reservations for 2 for a Friday night. you can reserve thru yelp yet I didn't see the time I wanted and their site says if you don't see your time, call us. we set aside tables for walk-ins.  so I called and the nice lady Rebecca told me the time I wanted was no problem. 

we get there and the hostess tells us it'll be a bit. We wait a few and then i go back up to ask how much longer and she said 10 min? that table over there looks like they're going to leave soon. 

so wait, you don't have a table for us??? 

I tell her, so what was the point of a reservation if you're making us wait? 
she said i can't control if people want to stay a little longer.

 while that's true, I find it hard that they couldn't reserve a table for 2 yet I saw they had already set aside a table for 8. 

I'm sure they made a reservation as well, just like I did. why not treat all your patrons the same? a reservation is a reservation. are they more important because they're a bigger party? and we are just 2 people. 

so we waited a few more minutes and then the hostess seated a party of 4 at another table instead of seating us. really? 

I kinda hyped this place up to my buddy i went with, and got there only to be told to wait. my reservation was pointless.  I was embarassed with my friend. 

I am really disappointed with their reservation system and not holding a table for us.
author: Alexandra A.

description: Everything was so good! - street corn was delicious, impossible tacos were yummy, and the service was on point- thanks Megan, you are super! Very helpful in guiding us through all the veggie options, and made the whole experience great
author: Jaymee W.

description: We were there last Sunday and the food was overly salty.  They were not very busy and the service had a lot to be desired.  It felt like we were bothering our waitress every time we asked for something.   We asked for more napkins and she brought us one napkin and we asked for more so she brought two more for our table of 4.  The atmosphere was fun but was ruined by the poor service.  I've been there several times and had great service but probably won't go back.
author: Coraleah N.

description: Hit or miss with the food. I've been here at least 5 times and I feel like the quality of food goes down each time (but never terrible). Friendly staff, and a fun environment. :)
author: Tracey P.

description:
What initially was supposed to be a 5 minute pit-stop to use the bathroom before heading out to Blondie's Bar, turned out to be an hour and a half just taking shots, drinking cocktails, and eating food. It's undeniable that Tex-Mex restaurants are the best places to celebrate Happy Hour, but I firmly believe this is the best one out here in the city.

I've been obsessed with Aqui Cal-Mex down in San Jose for their "Swirls" which is frozen house margarita mixed with their sangria. Now their swirls are no joke as it can easily get you on "another level". But honestly who has the time to travel 45 minutes south just to drink? Now when I discovered that West of Pecos sold their own version of the Swirl called "Sangre del Toro", I knew I had to try it. It was amazing just like Aqui Cal-Mex. Much smaller size but sure got the job done. Their drinks were fairly priced and of course their Management and Staff were so nice even if my friends and I were a little tipsy.

Unfortunately I can't say too much about their food as I only had their guacamole and chips. But at that moment, they were amazing. I do have intentions of coming back here soon. Maybe for another Happy Hour? Hopefully this time I can actually try their food because they look so delicious from the people seated next to me.
author: Denzell S.

description: I'm vegan and prefer this place over gracias madre just due to the fact that the guacamole here is by far one of my favorites...get the guac! If you want something light but filling, do the chips and guac and salsa and get a beer...the beers are huge as well!
author: Massiel S.

description: Came for happy hour after work. Made a reservation, but didn't really need one at 5:30pm, although the place filled up by the time we left at 7pm. I enjoyed the happy hour specials, which included nachos, tacos and margaritas. The margaritas were tasty and strong, and the chips were great to share. I wouldn't say the food was outstanding, but the fact that they were reduced in price and the ambience made it worth while. Service was good and made sure we could order another round before 6:30 when happy hour ended. Overall pleasant experience, would return.
author: Chelsea T.

description: Solid ribs, great brisket, good tacos, spicy drinks. Service was pretty good too and has gotten a lot better since the last time I went 5 years ago. Totally redeemed themselves from the previous time I went. If the owners are reading this - your waitstaff is nice, accommodating, and made the experience one to remember.
author: Bobby M.

description:
I never really hang out in The Mission district so when my friend suggested we do that for a change, I was definitely on board. We settled on a place close to some of the shopping on Valencia and so glad we did! 

This place is super nice and consistent with the Tex-Mex theme. Blue walls and dark wood around the place offer a more modern feel while the weathered looking table tops remind you of the Lonestar type tradition. Our service was ok. Not a lot of visits to the table but that's because they were super busy. It didn't bother me at all though, they were cordial. Here's what I had for dinner: 

-Started with the queso and chips, topped with house-made chorizo for $9. This was a classic dish and super good! the queso was a little more runnier than I'd prefer but thank goodness the flavors were there! I liked the nice touch of chorizo on top to seal the deal

-For dinner, I got the West of Pecos Fish Tacos for $15. 3 tacos stuffed with beer battered wild Alaskan cod, avocado, chipotle aioli and cabbage. First off, what a beautiful plate! Lots of amazing vibrant colors. Then you bite into it and WOW, has to be one of the best fish tacos I've had, probably due to the fresh ingredients. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this!! 

I love this city. There are so many gems around town and for the Mission, I would consider this to be one. Those fish tacos will keep me coming back time and time again. Go check them out!
author: Rockne H.

description: Pecos as Tex-Mex down. The ambiance is a perfect blend of Southwest meets the Bay. The drinks are tasty--grab one of their spicy margs. If you like tacos, you won't be disappointed with their fish. We didn't have the best service, forgot our drinks until our dinner came, but they gave a discount.
author: Laurisha C.

description: First stop on a food tour, and holy cow. Firstly, I can't believe i'm on a "food tour."  Secondly, that was a darn good taco. Finally, turns out mezcal and margaritas are great company with brunch. Awesome decor, great TexMex ambiance. Attentive wait staff. Bring friends and feast.
author: Veronica K.

description:
Food: Decent. Does the job, probably not coming back. With all the flavors of SF, this one was not memorable. 

Service: I am pretty patient, I get it. But I felt like we were forgotten about. The host was very apologetic when they forgot to put the food order in and we were waiting. Appetizer came out after main. She sent free churros. Thanks!

I believe they are new so probably still working out kinks. Give it a try, hope it's better for you!
author: alexandra n.

description: This was an amazing choice for our quick 2 days in SF. Our server was very helpful with the menu, the atmosphere was lively but not overwhelming, and the prices were right on. We ordered the crab enchiladas, street corn, and brisket puffy taco - I can't decide which one I liked more!
author: Kelz G.

description: Great place with good vibes, delicious appetizers and entrees, and fun decor. Yummy guac, seasoned thin and crispy chips, outstanding enchiladas served in a cast iron skillet. Will definitely go back!
author: Erika Z.

description: Great! Awesome staff, great atmosphere. Highly recommended, will definitely be back. Favorite if San Francisco for sure
author: Laura A.

description:
Excellent mexican joint!  Everything we ordered was delicious and great for sharing with a group if 4.  

Highly recommend this place if you're in SF and looking for some good food with great atmosphere.
author: Chris G.

description: Fave happy hour spot the atmosphere is super chill and kinda rustic the taco shells are made in the restaurant and fast e amazing! I know everyone's always down for street tacos, but trust me these are awesome that and the frozen margaritas are my thing also you really can't beat free home made chips with your order they're really flavorful for tortilla chips. Fave happy hour spot !!!
author: Michelle M.

description:
I am allergic to onions, garlic, and green onions. I expressed that when ordering my food and explicitly asked for my dish without those ingredients. I was told, "No problem."

When my dish arrived, it was prepared with onions AND green onions, so I politedly asked again, explaining a second time my allergy.

They took it back to the kitchen, and then after around 15 minutes, the came back. Guess what was in the salsa? ONIONS. At that point I gave up trying to explain my allergy.

To top it off, when the waiter took away my plate, he dropped all the dirty utensils on me and my handbag.

Please train your staff better. Thanks.
author: Grace Y.

description:
Being from Texas, I wondered in here curios AND a little skeptical, but I'll say I was really surprised. 

We started off with some badass queso and chips, which came out not closer to chili than to salsa - good stuff.

We had our main course of fajitas, and it was cooked to perfection. A perfect medium rare and all the sides were seasoned just right.

The bartender (we sat at the bar) was great with drink recommendations and they had a nice selection of whiskey as well.

If you happen to be in the Mission, I would say stop by, if not for the food for the drinks. You'll enjoy yourself.
author: Jay W.

description: Best guacamole Ive ever had served with slightly seasoned chips    Complimented the fajitas and grilled corn.
author: Alicia G.

description:
This place is really cool!!
I came here the other day w my friend, we were both hungry and wanted try something different our first option was the paella at picaro but the restaurant was closed so we decided to walk into the neighborhood luckily for us we saw this place open and not too busy, the concept is pretty cool Tex mex food kind of but the drinks are amazing I had the michelada made of mezcal and I had to order a second one our server was super friendly
And fast, I think her name is rebeka, she's the best , I'll definitely come back another time
author: Fabricio V.

description: We had reservations for 6pm on Saturday, didn't get our table until close to 6:20. Waitress took our order for drinks, appetizers and dinner and then disappeared. Long story short, waitress disappeared and service was terrible. We had to flag down our waitress and ask about our drinks, then she took the order again! Brussel sprouts were very good, chips and guacamole were good too. Fish tacos were nothing special. My friend ordered the salad and it was dry. The wait for more dressing was long. We were expecting a good food and decent service. We got neither.
author: Kathleen M.

description: Honestly I was excited to try this restaurant but it just really wasn't that good. It tasted pretty bad and I didn't finish anything on my plate and neither did my friend. I got a margarita and that was good, but that's basically it.
author: Angelica B.

description: This place is AWESOME!!! I love their decor, food, drinks and most of all there customer service.   This place was recommend to me by my family and friends so i will continue to pass it on to others . And best believe I will be returning again soon!!! You won't regret this place.
author: Ashly G.

description:
It's a-ight. 

3 stars go to: prickly margarita, brussell sprouts, shrimp fajita. 

I also tried their mole, but I think it's a little bit on the sweet side. Perhaps it's meant to be like that but I was expecting something more savory. I love the decor of the restaurant too, it's great for big parties and I especially love the fire hearth outside and we often got seated outside so it's awesome.
author: Rika P.

description:
Wow, West of Pecos... we racked up a nice little bill with pitcher upon pitcher of margaritas, but it made for a very memorable night!  Before I get there... let's talk food.

-Chunky Guac/Chips & Queso/Chips (sans chorizo):  Not as much "shareable" as I thought they would be.  The queso is to die for and I bet it's even better with chorizo.  Guac is definitely chunky and tasty.  If you're planning to have fajitas, you'll get some guac though... so I'd probably skip on the app then.
-Cast Iron Fajitas/Chicken:  I am used to monstrous portions of fajitas, so we thought we'd split them between two.  Not a good idea.  Not really enough to split, but still on the large size for one person to eat.  Definitely tasty!  I would eat these again.
-Green Chile Mac & Cheese:  Not impressed.  I think I was expecting the entire top to be covered in cornbread crumbles, and it wasn't.  The green chile was not as prominent as I expected it to be.
-Churrrrros:  Delicious!  One order can be shared by two for sure... unless you're like me and want them all to yourself.

OK drinks.  Pitchers on pitchers right?  Each one serves about 5 of those cups they give you.  My personal fave was the Infamous El Guapo.  Unfortunately, no tajin rimmed glass if you get the pitcher... I'm sure that would've made it even better.  The La Casa on the rocks was good too... pretty standard margarita.  Probably would've been really tasty as a frozen one though.  Not too impressed by the La Flama Verde.  We did order the Cactus Bowl which is meant for 2 people, but can easily be shared by at least 4.  Very very smokey taste to it.  It takes a certain type of palette to appreciate.

Service was significantly slow when we went.  We had apologetic servers for the most part, but there were times we seriously were wondering what was going on.  Sometimes it was to the point where we were waiting for a while just to get some more flour tortillas that our chicken fajitas were getting cold. :(  Kind of a bummer... but I don't think it was intentional.  They were pretty busy.  Rezzie recommended for sure!
author: Reena P.

description:
My first dinner at West of Pecos and I totally went the Southern route and got their Fried Chicken and Mac & Cheese.  That combo is the way to go!

Brown Sugar Buttermilk Organic Fried Chicken w/ Mashed Potatoes, Braised Collard Greens and Creamed Corn -- http://bit.ly/1zfrdwN
The Chicken was really good!  It's very similar to the fried chicken at Hops & Hominy, but it's about $5 cheaper.  Very crispy skin and the meat was very juicy and flavorful.  You get the whole half chicken and all the goodies that go well with it.  This is probably one of the best Fried Chicken entrees I've had in SF.  Rivaling Little Skillet's Fried Chicken by just a under a hair.

Hatch Green Chile Mac & Cheese --  http://bit.ly/1DWG2Mw
I liked their Mac & Cheese!  Had a nice cheesy consistency and the Green Chiles gave it a good spicy kick.  It was a great side dish pairing with the Fried Chicken.

I like the restaurant's atmosphere as it's very cozy, though it can be pretty loud.  Service was pretty good but the I felt drinks I had were a little weak, which for me since I'm not much of a drinker, isn't such a bad thing.  But if you go with a bunch of drinking buddies, it's something to take note of.

I heard West of Pecos has a very good brunch so that's one thing I'll be coming back to try.  Their Happy Hour is really good too with a good menu of drinks and bar bites such as ribs and tacos available at bargain prices.  It's a solid 4 stars!
author: Rodney H.

description:
Mohave margarita is my favorite! I would go back just for the drink itself. Thus the reason I am giving out 4 stars.  Food is OK right here. I got the kale salad it was kind of weird with some hard shell taco, beans and guacamole underneath. My friend didn't like his Primm #1 unfortunately. 

Staff is really helpful and I liked the atmosphere as well. We sit by the windows to it was great to people watch.
author: Amanda D.

description:
Popped into this spot to check out the Happy Hour scene. Within minutes of opening, patrons slowly trickled in to find a seat.  

We ordered the Guacamole and Queso. Your taste buds will not be disappointed if you do the same. The Habanero wings had good flavor, but you won't be upset if you skip them from your order. The Beef Brisket & Queso AND the Pork & Green Chile TACOs are another must eat. Delicious. 

I saw a Red or Green Michelada on the menu. The Green was stupendous with Spicy, Cilantro and Lime flavors. Perfect compliment to the Happy Hour arsenal of appetizers.  

They also have an orange hot sauce in a jar hiding somewhere. Be sure to ask for that too!  Who doesn't like a good orange sauce?
author: Andrew H.

description: Great margaritas and fried chicken.  The outside fireplace is perfect during a chilly night.
author: Diana h.

description:
I love the vibe of this place, there's cute decor and fireplaces! I've only been here for drinks and guacamole, but it keeps me coming back!

My favorite drink is the prickly pecos (it's not too spicy even though it says spicy on the menu, I hate spicy so it was a nice surprise). The drink is pink and wonderful! 

West of Pecos is a little "fancier" (but still casual) than their neighbors Puerto Alegre, which I find to be more authentic. I'm a big fan of both places depending on my mood.
author: Kelly F.

description:
This Place wreaks of violence.
From the stolen art from Native Peoples's on the Walls,to the small details on the menu like "Zuni Warrior".... and on top of that this place is run by a very racist, culturally incompetent white woman who has no place informing MISSION BASED GENTE on how to act and comport themselves in public spaces.
There are SOOO many other delicious, exciting and beautiful locations in the Mission. Let's quit supporting the gentry and continue to put our money in the hands of those making the Mission beautiful.
author: Lazzuly M.

description:
I've gotta say, this place place delivered on every front I could have imagined. Loud, busy, tables large enough to seat 10+, and super kid-friendly in the heart of the Mission. The kids menu even has a scavenger hunt printed on it to keep youngsters occupied (and wandering around the restaurant a bit). 

As for the food, the tacos were unique with a "puffy" tortilla and the enchiladas were authentic and delicious. The appetizers are incredible as well, and it's hard to save room with the creamy queso dip and grilled corn coming up first. Do your best to pace yourself because even the churros are amazing... hot and fresh with just the right crisp. Dare I say better than Disneyland?? Just get em and diet tomorrow.
author: Eric F.

description:
I only tried the flank steak tacos ($19) and they were pretty darn excellent. It came with guac, pico de gallo, sour cream, and three warm handmade tortillas. The very flavorful steak with veggies was served in a mini skillet.

I was with a large group for a birthday dinner, and service went rather smoothly. They have no cake cutting fee, and they cut the slices of birthday cake very cleanly & beautifully. Quite impressed!

FYI, they can split checks up to 6 ways
author: Katherine C.

description: Exceptional food and great, friendly service. The hostess and our server, Megan were so kind. Megan was the highlight of our dinner.
author: Kyle H.

description: I'm a fan of this place for a few reasons- 1) I'm usually able to get a reservation online via Yelp on the same day if need be 2) They have booths and who doesn't like booths when dining with friends?! 3) Fish tacosssssss yum and 4) margarita pitchers!!!
author: Leina K.

description:
Kathy's mission hunt was to pick a birthday dinner spot.... Well why don't I look at
my bookmarks. Table for 6 please, with tons of restaurants on the block, West of Pecos was the place to be on a Friday night. The decor had that Southwestern
feel, as you can see enormous bull horns hanging. Staff was friendly and service was quite fast when you're having girl talk and a pitcher of their Mexcal Mule, which btw was good! but gave me a hangover the next day LOL

What did we order?
Fish tacos-beer battered wild Alaskan cod, avocado, chiptole aioli, cabbage-15.00 for 3? I think that was kind of a rip off and the taste was not memorable.

Slowly roasted crispy pork flautas- delicious! cooked to perfection

Charred Corn on the cob-Guajillo chile butter-UMM you know the guy that pushes the cart around in the mission that sells these? please don't order it for 6.00 when you can get it for 1.00. 

Brown sugar buttermilk fried chicken-A lil bit soggy not crispy enough but great flavors

Tuna crudo tacos-Fishy and a lil bit tart, wasn't a fan but I do love raw food!!

Hatch green chile Mac & Cheese-Highlight of my meal!!!! Picture mac & cheese kicking you in your mouth!!!

Campfire Cornbread-Too sweet, was not a fan

Chunky Guacamole & Chips-Who doesn't love fresh Guac?


Thanks West of Pecos!!
author: Kathy V.

description: Went here for brunch with a group of friends. I would recommend getting the chips and guac and a Bloody Mary (comes with a slice of bacon!). While this isn't the cheapest place for brunch its well worth the price. Staff was friendly and attentive and the food was great! Left feeling happy and full.
author: Austin R.

description:
This place was great. I came here last night with a few friends and it was really easy to make a reservation online. The food comes really fast and the host and waiter provided great service. (5 stars). 

Prawn Fajitas: Solid meal. Little shrimp with peppers and onions. Served with 3 fajitas tortillas, guac, sour cream and salsa. Not spicy at all. I forgot to ask for hot sauce because I was so hungry. I would say that it was a decent sized portion as well. Be careful with the pan, its very hot and I definitely burned my arm. (4 stars)

Crab and Guac: This is good but not worth the extra money for the crab. Basically you can get regular guac and chips for 10 bucks and then for another 8 bucks you can add some crab to the top of it. (3 stars)

The drinks were solid as well. Great ambience and they have a nice variety of menu options so if people aren't feeling mexican food and say want.... some fried chicken, they got it.
author: Alyssa A.

description: We had a most enjoyable dinner celebration here for my daughter's birthday.  Loved the environment, decor and elements which fostered the theme of the restaurant.  The waitstaff was very attentive and added to the experience.  The beverages were tasty, Sangria and Margaritas all around.  The meals were plentiful.  Fajitas, Buttermilk Chicken and meat platter were ordered...shared and agreed all guests would return and recommend to friends.
author: Nancy M.

description: What a great place! They have unique drinks and stellar food options. Our servers were lovely and enthusiastic and took the time to make recommendations. My friend and I made adventurous drink choices and some of them weren't my favorite.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Went here on Valentine's day with my partner for dinner. I have been here before and love the place, but my experience this time was not as great as the previous ones. 

I had a 7:45 reservation, and although I was seated quickly, the wait staff was seriously lacking in service. We were given menus by the host (Bridgy) who was also managing that night. After waiting about 20-25 minutes to order a drink, Bridgy finally saw we had not received drinks and graciously took our order while she introduced us to our waitress, which we had not seen yet. We went ahead and ordered drinks and food with Bridgy to make sure we didn't have to sit and wait after receiving our drinks to order food. We received our drinks about 15 minutes after ordering. 

We ordered Chips and queso and Green Chili Mac & Cheese to share (excellent!!).  My partner ordered the puffy carnitas taco and I had the enchilada dinner. Both were rich in flavor and we recommend both to the person readig this. 

Our overall experience was a good one, but If it wasn't for Bridgy, we would have given our experience 3 stars...she really saved the day with the service we were given.
author: Jamal P.

description: DELICIOUS. The food here is so good. My boyfriend and I got a few different apps to share and they were also so exquisite. Good cocktails, fun vibe, overall great place to have dinner in the mission
author: Maggie A.

description:
everything is always amazing!  If you want boring traditional Mexican food, go elsewhere.  This chef is not only creative but successful, if you like your food to have a subtle but interesting twist to it. The Guacamole is the best I've had (large chunks, not too lemony)

Portions are small, but filling  Of course, prices are high because of the neighborhood.  Very comfortable decor and they have BOOTHS, which is always wins my heart.  Great for elderly parents.   

We had appetizer: guacamole & chips, Entree: 1 enchillada, 1 taco, 1 fajita; Desserts: ice cream sundae and 1 churro; 1 soda

Three of us were stuffed because the food is very filling

$77
author: Christine O.

description: This place is my "go to" when friends or family come for a visit. The place is really loud in a fun way. The food is amazing the  "Agua Fresca's" are DELICIOUS! Try the Butternut Squash Enchiladas are something you must try!  Give it a try and you will LOVE it!
author: Debbie L.

description: Puffy tacos & margs!!! It's always good! Fun environment  in the heart of mission. You can get a seat at the bar area pretty easily. I wish they had more staffs tho, they get busy on weekends.
author: Sandy L.

description: Excellent place to go esp with kids.  We went with the kids and they had a good time.  We went on a hot Sunday afternoon on a Saturday.  Our waitress was good.  Chips and salsa was amazing.  I ordered the fish tacos, the kids had a quesadilla and my fiancé had the carnitas soft taco which was to die for.  Overall, the food was soooooo good.  We sat outside and it was a great people watching afternoon on a sunny day.  Happy (soon to be) wife happy life.
author: Jill P.

description:
Food was delicious. Cocktails were excellent. Service was horrendous.

We sat by the bar - cool atmosphere, and it's a very lively place.

One entree was completely forgotten, and we had to track down the hostess/manager to assist. Our waitress barely checked in and didn't care too much that the entree came out 25 minutes later.

Recommend the fish tacos...
author: Brian M.

description:
Pretty chill place

The place looks like a bar from the outside but is actually a restaurant. Everytime I walk by I see the large open windows with people drinking and chilling, and there's a big TV inside, but it's actually not that much of a alcohol place

It's dark inside, and the furnishings are ok--mostly wooden stools/seats and such. The decor is pretty good though--chandeliers and other random decorations hanging from the ceiling.

I got a coffee and some nacho (qeso chips). The nachos were pretty good--the portions were huge, so much so that I was able to finish only 1/4th of it. The dip is also very thick, cheesy, and has a spicy "kick" from the chili toppings. The coffee was also ok--large fat cup, with milk and sugar served on the side. The service was also ok.

Overall, a pretty chill place to hang out.
author: Henry L.

description:
Wish I had discovered this place when I still lived in San Francisco proper! In short: West of Pecos is a low-key but nice Latin American restaurant with flavorful, beautifully plated food.

My favorites:

-Fish tacos: a plate comes with 3 tacos. You can also ask for smaller portions as well--we got 1 extra so we could split evenly. The batter is crispy and light but well-defined, and the fillings are a crunchy slaw and tangy sauce, which complement the fish very well. (Pro tip: eat them fast or the corn tortillas will start to lose structural integrity from the slaw)

-Maple brussel sprouts: I could eat these all day. I don't know what they put in this dish, but it is so comforting to eat. It is sweet yet rounded out nicely with a slightly salty/buttery flavor. Texture-wise, the sprouts are soft and minimally crispy.

-Churros: this dish comes with 3 churros and 2 sauces. All I need is that caramel/dulce de leche sauce, though. Churros were crispy outside and soft inside, but a couple of time started imploding in my fingers. No worries though, because that caramel sauce is amazing.

Worth checking out if you're looking for good food with a clean, rustic environment. Or if you just want a sangria and/or margarita. ;)
author: Julia N.

description: Great vibe, great drinks, fun destination. Like the big bar and mucho tequila choices. It has a sense of fun an lightness in an over serious mission. Great happy hour btw. The manager cares.
author: david c.

description: The food is so delicious. Great beer selection and tons of tequila. Nice place to splurge at.
author: Michelle B.

description: It gets an extra star because my boyfriend said the green Michelada was good. I guess the margarita was all right as well. The food was Taco Bell levels of authentic, (I'm down for Taco Bell) but I can't remember the last time I was willing to spend 80 dollars on it. The food just wasn't good, there is no way around it. It is also very overpriced for what you get, the portions were pretty big but that really doesn't matter if the food is gross. I would say skip this place and head to Puerto Allegre next door best margaritas in town, authentic and reasonably priced.
author: Hannah G.

description:
Wow what a brunch. We toured all over the city looking for a good brunch place on our first visit to San Fran and we saw this one on Yelp. 15 min later on an Uber pool we got here and we had one of the best brunch food we ever had! 

My girlfriend and I got the American breakfast which was good but the crown jewel was the croissant french toast. Devine. Nothing can't describe how enjoyable was that experience.

In a nut shell go there and order it!
author: Shachar M.

description:
My friends and I were really looking forward to coming here. We dropped by a week before without a reservation and realized quickly that the wait was not worth it. This was our second attempt.

TIP: Reserve in advance.... I think??

I question the value of making reservations at this place since our group waited about 25 minutes AFTER our reservation time before we were seated. The estimated wait time without a reservation is around 30-40 minutes, so I don't know if the five minutes I saved was worth it. 

SERVICE: Mediocre

The person at the check-in table was great at letting us know how long it would take for us to get seated despite the unusually long wait. Once seated, our waiter rarely dropped by to check-in on us. I had to use the "stare until they notice" technique on several occasions to get his attention. We asked for only hot sauce and he brought that PLUS their house salsa which they ended up charging us for. Once we finished our meal it took way too long for him to realize that we were ready. I used the stare tactic again and had to flag him down to give us our bill. Mind you many people were waiting for a table, so I presumed the staff would be eager to wrap things up. Maybe he was having an off day, but the reality of service-based jobs is that one person's actions can cascade into the entire night's efforts.

FOOD: Solid, but not memorable. 

The puffy tacos are great and filling at $6 each. I tried the carnitas and BBQ pork which were both slightly sweet tasting, but still tasty. The BBQ pork was better IMO. I'm a hardcore carnitas fan, but the meat was a bit dry. Ask for a few slices of lime. That will surely elevate things. The fried chicken entree has delicious sides like creamed corn, creamy mashed potatoes, and wilted garlic spinach that truly outshine the chicken. For $16, you get 4 pieces of chicken (2 thigh/breast, 1 wing, 1 drumstick) which is A TON. Share this with someone else. 
I haven't had the drinks, but keep in mind they are a bit pricey and range between $11-14/each. 

Sad to say this, but I don't think I'll be back!
author: Manisha S.

description:
My 5 stars is based off the brunch menu only. Although I did look around at other tables and their food looked amazing. 

Walked in on a Sunday afternoon and had no issue Getting a table. It was packed, but no crazy lines. Also the place is roomy so you can go to the bar and wait. The service was attentive and good. 

I got the American breakfast which comes with eggs, biscuit, and home fries. The biscuit is delicious. It's huge fluffy and crispy on the outside. No need to add butter or jelly on it because it's so good. Now if you want a life changing experience get the croissant French toast. Holy moly it was the best breakfast food I have ever experienced! First off it's huge. Secondly it's amazing! Not to sweet and not to cinnamon based flavor like some French toast. We opted for the butter and fruit on the side and it was worth it because the French toast is so damn good! 

I left stuffed satisfied and can't believe I've been missing out on such good brunch.
author: Krizia C.

description: While West of Pecos is yummy, I do not recommend ordering the artichoke. It came out hard as a rock and inedible. When we let our waiter know there was no offer of replacing it or comping it. We had hoped for a little better service in that regard.
author: Annelise S.

description: One of our favorite spots, the food is always very good and the service attentive, thats all I need for a five star experience.
author: David S.

description:
I love this place!!!!! Simple but amazing Tex Mex style food and drinks. The queso and chips is amazing I order it every time. Surprisingly for how busy this place gets I am usually seated or find a place at the bar within in a reasonable amount of time. They are super accommodating and always give stellar service. The nice girl Brigid that is a host there was so sweet and willing to fit my large party even though they didn't have a table that sat that big, she was kind enough to pull some chairs and make it work for us.

The food it self is a reason to come though, from the fish tacos to their puffy tacos to the sopapillas!!! I love it all, you can get a lot of plates and share like their riff on elote is super amazing and other various veggie plates too! 

The drinks are also amazing! Good booze, amazing in house juices and garnish to knowledgeable bartenders that know their stuff and know what you might like. If you get a brain freeze from drinking the frozen margarita too fast the nice host might even tell you a secrete to get rid of the brain freeze stat! 

I highly recommend this establishment for happy hour, or whatever hour it is. To all the reviewers that wrote it was crappy over priced Mexican food then you clearly have never A ate Mexican food that you should have known right away that it clearly states it is Tex-Mex and B if the name doesn't end in the suffix "eria" 9 times out of 10 then you should expect to pay above $10 per plate of food, and C if its on Valencia street in the Mission that seats more than 20 people at a time expect to be able to pay for the service along with tipping the staff kindly. I honestly don't know what people expect when going out to dinner sometimes.  

So if you want to try this place out expect to pay moderate prices, go in with the idea to share some small plates or get an appetizer and a large portion each and one drink and it shouldn't break the bank and fully satiate you.
author: Kate D.

description:
Hands down this place is in my top 5 of the city! 
-Best Margaritas 
-Amazing Queso
-Puffy Carnitas tacos are to die for.
- Classic delicious fajitas!
author: Mckall E.

description: Great atmosphere. Easy for brunch/lunch. Solid food. Service is a bit slow. Good for groups.
author: Mike K.

description: I don't know where Pecos is but this place is pretty good. Came here for brunch on a Saturday with a group of 12. NO WAIT! Can't beat a place in SF that doesn't have a line. Food's good and so are the drinks. Fried chicken was decent but I'd probably pass on it, recommend more of the breakfast options for brunch.
author: Rohit S.

description: This place has the best, most creative tacos EVER. Go to spot for brunch! And the margaritas are delicious too.
author: Ryan K.

description: I would like to counter the review that the seasonal vegan plate was bad. I thought mine was absolutely delicious! Since it is late summer, it had broccoli, squash, and sweet corn. The salsa that comes with it is not guac, and it's very good. The sweet corn was presented as a creamed corn (made with coconut) and it was AMAZING. I also really enjoyed the broccoli. The only components I did not care for were the rice and beans. These could definitely be spiced up. However, I would absolutely recommend this place and this particular dish, and agree that it is better than Gracias Madre. I hope that as the seasons change, the dish maintains its quality!
author: Lina L.

description: Nice atmosphere and a spacious restaurant. Food was good, but not exceptional. Worth thr money though
author: Martijn T.

description: Me and 5 of my girlfriends grabbed some drinks and snacks during happy hour on a Wednesday. Their HH runs from 5-6:30 M-F. They have margaritas, beers, cocktails all for $5 or less. They also have a few bites on the HH menu - Queso with Chorizo, Guac and Chips, Wings, and Texas Tacos. Tacos were good I got the beef brisket and the duck. The guac was good, but I personally like it more limey and salty. Queso was good too. It was fairly empty when we got there at 6pm, but by the time we got there it was pretty packed. Great place to catch up with friends.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Chicken was undercooked , may be my bad luck this time. Will try som other dish next time but of course not fried chicken. 
Three star because I really like the service and the interior. All those plastic chilies hanging in ceiling was pretty awesome.
author: RZ P.

description:
I loved this restaurant! 
I have seen this restaurant while walking on Valencia so many times but never tried it before tonight. 

In the heart of mission, this place is a great choice for Mexican food. We got the chorizo queso chips, the beef brisket taco, and the beef fajita. Everything was super tasty! The beef was nicely cooked and delicious! I also got a cocktail with mezcal and I loved it! I really recommend this restaurant! I will definitely come back.
author: Looblue L.

description: Had an unbelievable dinner here. We were able to quickly sit down at a comfortable tall table in the bar, at 8 PM on a Friday night. Not bad for Valencia St! We started off with some guacamole, which was real fresh with pretty hefty chunks of avocado. I ordered two of the puffy tacos, carnitas and brisket. The meat was so tender and mouth watering. Extremely well crafted. The puffy taco shell was also uniquely delicious. Great texture and great flavor to go with the taco fixens.  I also sampled the fried chicken that my brother ordered, it is surely a highlight of the menu. I've heard that the queso is incredible here, and I'll certainly be back to try it!
author: Alex E.

description: Loved this place! The guacamole was delicious as were the fish tacos! I would recommend making a reservation as it does get busy but definitely worth the wait! The staff was very friendly as well!
author: Molly B.

description: Watered down margaritas, terrible service, even worse food. The only thing i liked was the French fires and the lights. I would just go to the velvet cantina it's the same price but a 102% better in food service, and margaritas.
author: Cody R.

description:
I'm not a big fan of Mexican food in general but this place was pretty good and had a great ambiance. 

Food: the pork flautas were really good. The mushroom puffy taco was my favorite dish by far - I would go back just for that. Others said the enchiladas were good too. The crabamole wasn't that great. And if they recommend ordering a salsa that costs extra, don't do it - it was pretty bad. Just order a side of habanero sauce if you like things spicy. 

Service wasn't that great.
author: Laura D.

description:
Wandering around the mission on a sunny Saturday morning and I ended up at West of Pecos for brunch. I was more than happy to stay once I arrived. The place has a great vibe - with the bushels of chili peppers hanging from the ceiling and the friendly staff - I enjoyed my time there. 

The brunch menu takes classic American brunch and gives it a bit of a Mexican spin. First off I tried the bloody mary, which I was a bit apprehensive about (made with interesting ingredients). However, the combination they came up with (which I cannot remember) tasted just great! To eat, we had the pecos eggs benny (comes with a side salad and home fries) and the pork belly breakfast tacos (no side). Both were delicious! 

West of Pecos does not have outdoor seating, but there are tables by the windows, which is almost as good. The perfect spot to grab a drink or a meal, anytime of the day.
author: Aletta B.

description:
West of Pecos can be an enjoyable experience if you order the right things. Here's a quick summary of my preferences:

The Not So Good: green chile mac n cheese, side of rice and beans, chicken enchilada mole
The Good: West of Pecos fish tacos with the sauce, chopped harvest salad with chicken, fried green tomatoes

The green chile mac n' cheese smelled so good when it first came to the table, but the disappointment started at the first bite. It is extremely bland. Since the restaurant is labelled on Yelp as Tex-Mex, I had particular expectations for the rice and beans. The rice was green and the black beans had an off taste. Altogether, it was a bit bland too. The chicken mole was unexciting.

Now for the good dishes I tried, they were REALLY GOOD. The West of Pecos fish tacos were loaded with lots of fried fish and the sauce added a nice tangy flavor. The tacos were delicious with my Modelo. The fried green tomatoes were crispy and paired nicely with the lemon aioli. Lastly, the chopped harvest salad with chicken was absolutely amazing. If there's anything I'd come back for, it would most definitely be for this salad! There was just a great balance with the crunchy jicama, soft lettuce, smooth avocado, and slight bitterness from the queso fresco. 

Customer service was great and the outside seating with the heat lamp was perfect for a chilly night when I was there.
author: Jane P.

description:
Stumbled upon this spot as a pre meal venture before going to a concert down the street. My friend and I came in and got seated quite quickly and luckily we made it in time for HAPPY HOUR!

Happy Hour drink specials are deadly, as you can't get better than $3.00 tequila shots. Plus, the tasty Shiner beer is priced at the same.

We mostly got tacos and the hands down favorite was the HONEY DUCK tacos. Good balance of sweet and salty and couldn't help but savor every bite. Big ups to the presentation of the tacos. Appreciated how it was brought out visually.

I'll definitely be back for happy hour. I'm already thinking about that Honey Duck Taco.
author: Vincent L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Great brunch, great for dinner, great for cocktails. The Tex-Mex food is a nice change up from the Mexican food you usually get in SF. The brisket hash is a terrific brunch dish and the puebla old fashioned is a terrific cocktail. Highly recommend.
author: Bob A.

description:
First off, I'm very impressed with the new reservation system called Yelp SeatMe. I was able to secure a table on Saturday night within 24 hours of my booking. It worked like a charm!

Though West of Pecos was simply just alright. We arrived early and sat at the bar for a cocktail. I had the Roadrunner margarita consisting of Mescal, thyme, mandarin, and lime. It seemed a little off balance, too much smoke and not enough citrus to cut it. I have had drinks here before and they were great, but this time around the cocktails were prepared in a rush and didn't have the love they deserve.

As for the food, we ordered the queso and chips, which arrived room temperature and if you know queso than you know it cools off very quickly. It's better to serve it on the hotter side than cooler and by 2 1/2 chips in, it was already cold and not tasty. 

The lobster enchiladas were excellent. Big pieces of lobster in a nice creamy- green sauce. And only $16, which seems like steal for lobster and quality entree such as this one! 

I'd give this place another try though next time just for cocktails and some apps.
author: Melissa P.

description:
The enchiladas taste like a really white person made them. The Queso was good but everyone loves the fake cheese on top of nachos at baseball games. I got the lobster enchiladas and they were alright, the portion was really small and incredibly spicy. The regular enchiladas were the same size and looked like more of a rip off. My margarita tasted like lemonade. 

Customer service was great. No problems there. Just disappointed in the authenticity of the food and thought the atmosphere felt forced. Whoever designed this place to emit a Mexican vibe, tried and missed. Probably a side-effect of the techie takeover.
author: Sarah P.

description:
I was with a V.I.P. party of 8 and these awesome people were so quick to accommodate us. Everything was PERFECT from start to finish. 

FRESH - CLEAN - QUIET ENOUGH TO TALK IN A NORMAL TONE AND NOT HAVE TO SCREAM - BEAUTIFUL DECOR AND ATTENTIVE SERVERS.

Great small plates for all and good fresh ingredients in each.

They have Coca Cola bottled in Mexico which is made from Cane Sugar, not refined white.

I had the Harvest Salad 
Jicama, corn, queso fresco, avocado, crispy garbanzo beans, cilantro vinaigrette with added Steak - a perfect meal!

So coming back!

Question: Is that Long Horn Bull real? The horns are HUGE!
author: Rick L.

description: Good gauc. Good puffy tacos. Good margaritas. The hot sauce is awesome that they make there. Never bummed at West of Pecos.
author: Zac B.

description:
I went here for the Bar:

Here it is starting from 5 stars:
1) I didn't like the Mezcal Mule.    
2) The 16 dollar Pinot Noir in a can.   Wow.
3) They didn't have Churros Con Chocolat.   They ran out. :( 
4) They tried to charge us for #3 anyway.

Okay all in all a very lousy experience.  
Okay +1 for this.  I did like the ambiance and I got parking in the front because everybody was at Burning Man. lol. :)   People say the food is good but I wouldn't know since they didn't have the one food item I wanted.  Again see #3 above.
author: Homer S.

description:
Ended up here for a Paint Nite so I didn't get the opportunity to sample the menu like I would normally dining - just did a few apps and drinks but really liked the casual ambiance and the food we had. 

The jalepeno mac and cheese was SO yummy and super heavy and big for an appetizer. It's a skillet of deliciousness and the Anaheim chili flavor gives is a real kick. Much heavier than I thought but SO good...the two of really didnt dent it but it was definitely super tasty and I would recommend to mac n cheese lovers for sharing. We also got a side of the asparagus which had the cotija cheese and seasoned SO well. Really tasty and fresh. Definitely want to try the cornbread (in a skillet) looked amazing, as well as their tacos. I would definitely go back to try it. Located in the heart of the Mission shenanigans I can see myself going back here. 

They do have a happy hour that goes till about 6:30 and they have a few things on the menu (like the guac) that's $5 and a few things that have price knock-offs but not a whole lot. The frozen marg is on happy hour but not the one on the rocks - so really their happy hour isn't all that great! But food/drinks are just wished they actually had some specials! 

Fun atmosphere and nice staff. Going back for sure!
author: Priya S.

description:
On top of good location (Valencia in Mission), good decor (hip), good food (Tex-Mex), cocktail bar, good service, takes reservations online...there's one aspect I bet most ppl didn't know...

THIS PLACE IS KID-FRIENDLY! It has a kids menu! It has high chairs! It gives you crayons! There's a changing table in the bathroom (at least the women's).

Like woooooow, how could that be? But that really is the case! And because the place is pretty big, it's pretty easy to get a reservation or just walk in and get seated. 

We've eaten here many times and everyone has their own favorites. Here's are some of ours: 

--- cheese dip: my husband's favorite. super rich creamy spicy cheese dip to go with the chips. SO GOOD. but I think there's bacon in it so not vegetarian.

--- burger: my husband's second favorite. the fries are juicy and plump and the burger is good.

--- fried chicken meal: my favorite. It is HUGE. three pieces of delicious juicy well-seasoned crispy chicken + stewed (sweet) corn + greens. I never can finish it. It is SOOO GOOD.

The fajitas and tacos and grilled veggies are also good. Just not as interesting to me personally.

Seriously this place is top-notch! I don't care if it's authentic Tex-Mex or whatever, it is JUST GOOD.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Food: 3
Service: 4
Atmosphere: 5 
Cleanliness: 4

I feel like I just ate at a friend's house. I loved their interior design! It made the menu and food seem better than it actually was. I even like the font on their menus- it made me feel like "heck yeah, I'm so cool, I'm eating in the Mission" "...and now I'm going to pay twice the price for some food I could have totally made at home!" 

Okay so I don't mean that in a bitter way, because their guacamole was exemplary and my homemade guacamole (that I've never actually made) would hardly compare... It just kind of blew my mind that a vegan sandwich of 

Avocado, fried green tomato, arugula, brioche (and some totally flavorless potato wedges) 

A side of house made guacamole and chips

And three petite fish tacos (fried in beer batter and topped with a sprinkle of beet/cabbage/sauerkraut) 

Cost the two of us $41. No drinks, just water, no frills, no extras.  

So what good do I have to say about this place? Staff was on point, and did a good job serving. Again, the guacamole was mesmerizing, the interior and exterior decor was exciting. It made all the rest seem quite alright.

Would I return? 

Maybe. Maybe not... Are you buying next time? :)
author: Cassandra E.

description: Very average food. Salsa was stale. Peppers were over done. Squash tacos were overly bitter. Undercooked chicken. To the credit of the server, she took back the shishito peppers but very hard to take back most of the stuff.
author: Puneet L.

description: Throughly enjoyed my experience here. Happy hour 5-6:30pm with $8 margaritas and $3 tacos (duck, chicken, pork, and other options). Pork with green chilies was spicy and my favorite. Service team was great, food and drinks came quickly, dining/bar options for seating had something for everyone. Really great place to meet up with friends in the Mission District, only a block away from the 16th St Mission BART station.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
They serve brunch! Excellent benedict and crispy home fries.  Prices are great and the servings are larger than average.  One of the better brunches on Valencia.

I took away two stars due to the terrible service I received on 4/16/16 around 11am.  The waitress was just plain rude and rather abrasive. She not once ever said "thank you," or "you're welcome."  She also overcharged us for a side order of bacon and though she did adjust the bill, she took no accountability on her end or acknowledgement regarding that. I don't know how to explain it...her server table-side manners were just awkward and harsh.
author: Tara K.

description:
We stumbled across this place on our walk around Mission in search of brunch food and we were so glad we did. We were greeted by the owner Tyler and quickly seated in the sitting area near the bar. Our server quickly greeted us and gave us recommendations on drinks and food. 

We started with some El Guapo margaritas (so delicious), and some queso and chips. The queso was amazing, with bits of chorizo mixed inside with fresh chips, and our chips were always refilled by our server. For our entree we opted for the fish tacos and the chicken and churros (their tex-mex twist on typical fried chicken and waffles). The chicken was delicious with crispy skin and paired so well with the sweetness from the piping hot churros. The battered fish was also delicious and we loved the house hot sauce that went with it. 

We were too stuffed for dessert, but we would definitely come back. This place does get packed and noisy so it's a great place to bring a large group of people to get pitchers and pitchers of margs!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
This place is a good one to bookmark! I walked in and immediately saw that they had crayons + kids menus which I of course asked if I could have one just for funsies. The waitress had to go in the back to print more kids menus so I could color while we waited for food -- she definitely hooked it up! 

Food was fantastic, definitely planning on going back more regularly.

Favorites:
* Crab guacamole
* The veggie option for tacos
* Margarita + Sangria drink (YUM)
* Coloring menu (duh)
author: Alexa H.

description:
At one time, this was one of my favorite places on Valencia Street so I took a friend from out of town.  We ordered a drink and it took thirty minutes to arrive and that was only after I asked the hostess for some help.  Even then the drink order came back wrong.  You would think after that, that the server would be checking in on us, but no we were still mostly ignored.

The food wasn't as good as it was a few months ago - but I must confess that may have been influenced by the wait.

Also, the manager comped our first drink and acted like he was doing a really nice thing.  I think after a thirty minute wait at six o'clock in a mostly empty restaurant, the whole meal should have been comp'd.  

The Devil's Tooth cocktail is still one of my favorites!
author: Dallas N.

description:
Went back for brunch and it was great. We got:

Burger- solid
Brisket and eggs, yummy
Eggs Benedict- very tasty
Fish tacos- also very tasty

Staff was very friendly. Kid friendly and spacious, right in the middle of 16th and Valencia restaurant epicenter ...
author: Lo F.

description:
Just came here for the churros on our food tour of Mission! 

Very good, nice and fresh - and I loved the caramel and chocolate dipping sauces. 

My favorite though- dipping the churros into the sundae. It was delicious and a great end to our food tour with Avital! 

The environment was great, very casual and friendly and the wait wasn't too long either! Great service.
author: Dominic W.

description:
I had an amazing experience in this place.
Tried their fire heal cocktail and it was amazing and their appetizers were awesome. Now that I'm writing I want some more  The heirloom tomato and Burrata cheese was tasty and chopped salad was delicious. The staff were so nice and the lighting  and decoration were just perfect.
author: Shirin Z.

description: No issue giving your table away while you are waiting for it to be cleaned.   Then my other option given was the corner of the bar.  There are multiple two seat tables open.  Was looking forward to some good tex mex. A nice taste of home.  Now these folks can kiss my texas rear end.
author: John D.

description: This is one of my favorite spots to go to in the Mission. Which is WEIRD. I mean it's Tex-mex... Who gets excited about tex-mex? I'm Mexican and I almost feel like I shouldn't be into any Tex-mex cuisine. But damn this place is good! Try their crabamole!! They actually put a ton of crab into it, which is refreshing. Oh and my friend got grits. I don't know how they made it. They definitely added a lot of corn to it and it tasted DELICIOUS. I'm not a grits person at all to boot too. Not a huge fan of their enchiliadas. I had them the first time I went there. But just awhile ago I went and ordered the fish tacos. SOOO GOOD! This is easily one of those staple spots that I keep coming back too. Drinks are yummy too! I had the El Guapo I believe.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Stopped by for a Friday happy hour (5-6:30pm) and scored two seats at a booth with a huge picture window onto Valencia. Prime people watching of the promenade of both fashion plates and fabulous freaks. Great decor; a modern take on frontier westerns.

Had two margaritas - they were pretty tasty, but a bit inconsistent. The first was sweet (maybe too much agave), while the second was heavy on the citrus. Both were sippable. Shared an order of chips and guacamole. The guac was bland, so we doctored it with a liberal sprinkling of the excellent house-made habanero hot sauce. 

I'll be back for happy hour some time soon. There were plenty of other value-priced snacks and drinks to try.
author: Carole B.

description:
Tex-Mex? Count me in. Any time. Any where. Any pla....

Okay, not any place. For example, now that I've checked out West of Pecos, I probably wouldn't return again. While it was good, it certainly wasn't great, which I'm surprised by since California is way closer to both Texas and Mexico than my home on the east coast is... and we've definitely got more delicious places than Pecos.

One of my personal issues with the place was the seating arrangement. Because we had a large group, we were sat at a dining table that was pushed up against a wall. Meaning the only other "head" seat put that person - me in this instance - in the middle of most waiters path. My chairs was kicked by everyone that walked by, and both my purse and coat were constantly being jostled off the back of my seat. It was just a super unpleasant experience.

The blood orange margarita was lovely (I appreciated the enormous wedge of fruit that came with it) - they definitely pour a strong drink here, because the taste of tequila overpowered the blood orangeyness. Not that this is the end of the world, but one drink was plenty for me since I'm not a huge tequila fan to begin with.

I tried the guacamole and chips for appetizer - again, good, but certainly nothing revolutionary or memorable. It was pretty generic guac, though I do agree with my dinner mates - it was incredibly salty (then again - and maybe this is my paranoid speaking - maybe that was the plan; I've seen Jon Taffer's "Bar Rescue" enough to know that salty foods make people drink more. I'm on to you, WoP).

The vegetarian options weren't as plentiful as I would have liked, so I ended up settling on the tried and true stuffed chile rellano. It was the spiciest pepper I've ever had - again, intentional? Or just the work of novice chefs who didn't remove either the seeds or spine of the pepper? I also found the entire thing to be entirely dry and begging for more queso. I hate not finishing food, but in this case I just couldn't do it.

Thank goodness for all the snacks waiting for me back in my hotel!
author: Steff D.

description: waitress was fantastic ambiance was excellent, mom wasnt very happy with her dish so im torn, an she did fall ill that nite, my food was ok no ill affects, with so many spots to choose i say i would try another spot before going back
author: Robert G.

description: Really enjoyed everything we ordered. Tasty delicious food, fresh ingredients, good service. I liked that the chairs were solid and big enough to hang my backpack from the back.
author: Tom V.

description: Best fried chicken I've ever tasted and I was extremely surprised to find this type of flavor at a Mexican restaurant since fried chicken is not normally the highlight when eating such cuisine but goodness the meat is incredibly tender and juicy the seasoning and texture of the skin is mouth watering! Grilled street corn, cream corn, and spinach were all made to perfection. The one item not pictured here that was a bust was the flank steak it was overcooked and had a burnt taste but besides that this place is amazing!
author: Mrs. Custodio A.

description:
I don't know how this place has 3.5 stare b/c I beg to differ

SETTING: really spacious & tons of interesting southwestern decors like chilis hanging from the ceiling, cattle skulls, & little skeleton dolls. We came on a sunny day,so the place was refreshing&well lit w/their open doors&windows and natural lighting from the roof

FOOD: 
Sangria - came in a cool vase. super refreshing w/ cinnamon in it that surprisingly tasted really delicious 
Chunky guac & chips - fresh chunky pieces of guac w/slices of cherry tomatos, green onions & a splash of lime to eat w/their crispy chips..yum! Def recommend as a starter
Stuffed Poblano Chile- absolutely amazing & highly recommend ordering! Great flavors inside the chile w/ the eggs,corn, smoked cream&cheddar. Brussel sprouts cooked perfectly. The home run were the home fries, perfectly crispy on the outside but still soft on the inside. Best home fries ever

SERVICE: Very attentive & super friendly that one of the servers had a small convo w/me&my bf asking us how our day was&how we were doing. Jst things like that is a plus for me as a customer & makes a diff in the experience

Overall, had a wonderful experience&will def be coming back again
author: Trina N.

description: The food was pretty good, but I was disappointed with the service. My order was standard - salad, side of chicken (which was on the menu), and dressing on the side. Yet the chicken never came. Finally, when I asked for it, it came toward the end of the meal. And despite a genuine apology from the waitress, I was still charged for a $6 side of chicken which I had to just box and take home at that point. It's a pricey place, so I'd expect more.
author: Riri S.

description:
Delicious! Excellent service and ambiance. Had the crab enchiladas, rice and beans and others had the green chili 
Hamburgers, chile rellenos, corn, guacamole and chips, bread pudding and churros. Yummy for our tummies!
author: Anna M.

description:
Awesome atmosphere! Buttermilk fried chicken is amazing!  Service was great!!
Large amount of choices for vegetarians! 
I have been 3 times now and it has been great every.
Highly recommend making reservations it's a very popular spot and in a great location!
author: Elaine W.

description:
In a neighborhood full of great Mexican and other international restaurants, this place is just ok.  We ordered guacamole for the table, and it came out very chunky and difficult to eat, because how they artfully placed lime and avocado wedges to make it look "pretty."  The sangria tasted like it was very obviously made of cheap wine with NO fruit chunks.  The fish tacos were overloaded with red cabbage and fell apart.  And the tortillas were rather stiff and flavorless; not the warm corn goodness I'd expected.

On the plus side, they do have a decent happy hour until 6:30pm and the service was friendly.
author: Sona P.

description:
It's so hard to find a place where EVERYTHING you order is delicious. My friend first brought me here for a birthday dinner (Thanks Shawna Boo). It's pretty dim inside but I love the ambiance and the decor. They also have outdoor seating with stringed lighting. Super cute. 

We had the mac and cheese, brussel sprouts (oh.em.gee), fish tacos and corn bread. My friend loved the mac and cheese, we both agreed that the brussel sprouts were the best we've ever had, the corn bread had actual corn in there! Along with some peppers, which added a nice little kick. The fish tacos were also amazing and of course we didn't skimp out on dessert. By then we were both full as can be but ya know, we had to.  We got the churros and even though I was only able to get half of one in me, the half that made it in was quite satisfying. 

I've been back again since with my friend and this time we brought our other friend, Irene L. there for her birthday. Again, everything was amazing. The waitress is super friendly and she's been our waitress twice (wait, is she the only waitress there?) I can't wait to be back again. I'll find someone who has a March birthday...
author: Annie C.

description:
Best happy hour ever. 

Many times I've dined at West of Pecos during that magical time between 5:00 and 6:30 on week nights, enjoying delicious (and inexpensive) tacos, not-too-sweet margaritas, and generous helpings of guacamole and chips, and I hope, before I depart this mortal realm, to dine there many more times.
