Food: Pozole (so excited about this) was the worse pozole I've ever had. My cook from Japan can make this better. I was hurt by this dish. The chili broth was unstructured and the pork meat was chewy. The hominy had a stange taste as well. I had to add 4 lime wedges to bring the flavor profile up but it didn't work. Flat out disappointment. 

Tostada Salad was good. Nice presentation but overall just another salad. 

The texas ribs were tender and moist. The slaw next to it was okay. 

The dessert menu was strange...nothing authentic about it. Cherry and something crisp?? Where in west of pecos do you get that??? 

The only time I will return to West of Pecos is when I go home to Texas.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
West of Pecos is a great example of Valencia Street's ever accelerating gentrification and downward slide. Not only is the establishment a big tacky eyesore (and its patrons the type of people you'd expect to find in the Marina), the food is overpriced and inferior to the infinitely better (and long established) Puerto Alegre.

Here's to hoping WoP's existence proves to be short lived.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
Went here for dinner on a Monday night and was immediately stoked about the menu. Everything on it is right up my alley. I ordered a house margarita for $9 that was very tasty, but unfortunately not as big as I would've liked. I ended up getting two and loving them both. My boyfriend and I split chips and queso as an appetizer, and I got the brisket sandwich. It wasn't the most amazing brisket I've ever tried, but I was pleased with it. I left full and tipsy and happy.

Only downside was that the service was slow. I think our waitress was slammed with large tables though, so I can't fault her.
author: Laura P.

description:
Our cheery strawberry blonde waitress and the round of welcoming salutations as we pushed past heavy front doors set the tone for a fun evening at West of Pecos. 

We ordered: 
-- make your own lemonade, $4: you get a glass of ice & a yummy lemon juice concoction & add as much or as little soda water & simple syrup you want. Loved this!
-- pozole, $8: as much as I love my female bff's homemade version, WoP's lighter rendition made me eternally happy; no visible fat bubbles floating in the broth-yay! Loved the crunchy hominy & chopped red onion. 
-- ceasar salad, $8: pumpkin seeds added an interesting flavor & texture. 
-- roasted corn, $6: my favorite menu item in the world right now. Loved the sweet chili cream. Cut in smaller pieces, so as not to get your face all messy. 
--grilled pacific prawns, $15: three humongous prawns, topped w/ tomato & avocado on three mini tortilla rounds. Awesome cucumber salsa. Get this! 
-- carnitas, $14: bf couldn't decide between this & the steak. I don't eat a lot of pork, but this lean pulled pork looked appetizing & 'safe.' (Those who know my crazy meat issues know what I mean.) I loaded up a tortilla w/ it & the avocado/corn/cherry tomato salad & was a very happy girl! So much flavor! 

The three desserts did not tickle our fancies, so we passed. However, we will be back to try the steak, chile relleno, cornbread & ribs. Get your asses over to this brand-spanking new establishment! The Tex-Mexy atmosphere is sleek & fun, owners (same as the Woodhouse Fish guys) come around to make sure you're all set & the food is just plain well made.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Food was pretty good. Décor was nice. Had a lot of decoration throughout the restaurant.  Cowboy hats, a lineup of dolls etc. Had fish tacos that were pretty good.
Good place to try once.
author: Felecia W.

description:
Pleasantly surprised - Don't ask me why, but sometimes when a place has such a polished appearance, I almost expect the food to be chain-restaurant quality (ie sounds good, cooked poorly).   Might just be the tex-mex decoration.  Gotta be sure to set yourselves apart from all the Lone Star steakhouses out there! 

This was most certainly not the case here.  Everything we ordered was great.  The drinks were awesome - I recommend the Owl Hoot if you like bourbon.  Can't recommend anything else as that's all I drank!  Had to resist ordering a third.

We got the mac n cheese for an appetizer, which was good, but we regretted ordering it as it was very filling.  For dinner we got the ribs and the flat iron steak.  Both were cooked perfectly and tasted great.   Will definitely go back.

One small thing - the flourescent lighting in the back kitchen area is throwing off the ambience...  I realize the cooks need to see, but its kind of off-putting.  We saw there was seating back there - if they had tried to seat us near those lights, we would have had to politely refuse and wait for another table...
author: Todd S.

description: My friends and i stumbled upon this gem last Sunday for brunch, the decor was great and the food was amazing. Service was very kind and friendly. The menu was reasonably price and so were the drinks. I will definitely come back!
author: Ernesto Z.

description: Came here over the weekend with a couple friends. Pretty chill atmosphere... Another "hipster" spot in the Mission. We were seated pretty quickly, but it took a while for someone to take our order. We tried a pitcher of the La Flama Verde margarita, which is a cucumber/ jalapeño margarita. It was pretty yummy!! We also ordered the chips and guacamole... OMG!! By far the best guacamole I have ever had!! In fact we ended up with a second order. I had the Lobster enchiladas, and was disappointed. It's supposed to be dinner, but no rice and beans... All I got was 2 very small enchiladas. My friend ordered the St Louis Ribs, and she got a whopping 3 very small ribs and that's it!! My other friend ended ordering the fried chicken. This plate came with mashed potatoes, collard greens and 3 pieces of chicken, but she was disappointed also. The chicken was dry and the greens weren't very tasty. The only reason I gave this place 3 stars was for the drinks and the chips and guacamole. I would possibly come back for drinks, but not for dinner. Definitely not with the $140 we paid for 3 people!
author: Nivia J.

description: Like an upscale Chevy's. Servers were very nice, drinks good, but food was meh. Which is not a good thing considering all the other restaurant options on the same block.
author: Steven W.

description: Found this little gem on a Friday night and was able to get in quickly! The pork belly with brussels sprouts was delish. Great beer specials. Ill be back.
author: Amanda Y.

description: Six words for West of Pecos:  New-american take on Cowboy food.
author: Stephen Y.

description: Love the text mex food! The artichoke and lobster was good. The fish tacos, carnitas, and chicken were also good. Service was also excellent. Would definitely come back to this mission joint.
author: Anthony N.

description: I have eaten here before & loved the old menu!!! My fiancée & I ate there last night and thought our meal was horrible & that the new menu was not a great selection at all. They are trying to make it a cowboy type food selection & took away the best selections which were Mexican dishes. As much as there are taquerias everywhere people come to the mission for Mexican type cuisine hello???? Anyways I hope they change it back to the old menu for new & old patrons that frequent the mission as myself!!!!!
author: Marguerite S.

description: Best SW style food in the city! I loved everything I ate! The guacamole was to die for and the fish tacos were out of this world! Brunch here is a real winner too! I loved sitting out on the small front patio next to the fire.  Wonderful food, great atmosphere, friendly service!
author: Laura C.

description: Friendly service, great ambiance and delicious food. Highlights had to be the house margarita (sweet, spicy and with some major kick) and prawns appetizer.
author: Julie Z.

description: Nice place with a great staff. Food was good but nothing to write Grandma to! I had the Margaret's Pork Chop. Good but not the best. Nice presentation. Thick pork chop surrounding with some creamy kind of radishes but bland. Pork chop was on the dry side.
author: Hum V.

description: This place would get 5 stars if their happy hour ran an hour later than it does.  The tacos, margaritas, queso, guac, and tequila shots are delicious and a great price during happy hour! Unfortunately it's tough to get there before happy hour ends at 6:30 when I get off work at 6.
author: Alyssa K.

description: It was hard to figure out which style of food they serve. Fusion-american meets mexican-southern? :/  $$$$
author: Santi S.

description:
I love this place.  It's become my new "place" in the mission...  Why?  It's huge, so it can accommodate dates of 2 people, or bigger parties of 6-8 that I occasionally find myself in.  

I love the bar.  The bartenders are top notch and it ranks as one of the best Old Fashioned's in the city, which is the drink I use to rate bars since it's so variable how people make it.  They also serve beer in these HUGE iced goblets which I think is awesome.  The bar is large enough and with enough standing space that I don't feel the need to go elsewhere while waiting for my table.  (it's usually a bit of a wait, they've been packed since they opened).

Food. I love it.  I like the Maple Turkey Flautas and Guacamole for starters.  The Flat Iron Steak and the Carnitas were excellent main dishes, and I'm a huge fan of their new margaritas.  It's the kind of food that is tasty, but not so off the edge that it becomes a once-every-six-months type of place.  A bunch of the other great spots in the Mission kind of fall in that category for me, either because of the food-type or the price. Is it Tex-Mex? No.  I lived in Texas for 4 years, and this place definitely has Texan roots but with a California edge. But then, with all the mexican food in the mission, I'm guessing I really enjoy this place because it's not a typical taqueria, and I can sit down and have an nice meal, and still feel like going back.

The owner is always floating around and is super-duper friendly. He's been by my table nearly every time I've been in there, and has comped a few drinks to boot.  Love. It.
author: Craig d.

description: We came earlier than the scheduled seating time, so we sat at the bar instead. I liked the wide bar stools, the hooks underneath to hang your purse and coat and to boot, food came pretty quickly. The lamb meat balls were delicious, the pepper was fantastic as a starter. Also enjoyed the Brussels sprouts with bacon. Had the right execution. Not too soft not too crunchy just right.  I'm a big fan of a small plates, so I thought the food came in the right proportion and not so overwhelmingly large as you'd get in the Midwest or the East Coast. Duck tacos were quite a nice size and tasty. I am not a connoisseur of southwestern cuisine, so I liked this induction by my dinner companion. My dinner companion ordered margarita with prickly pear, the color of the drink was a bit pink and pretty unusual, and it tasted good. I don't generally drink California wine and they didn't have any old world red, but they did have one red from New Mexico which I thought was interesting, as I never had it. Of course regardless how good or lousy food is, if you are with the right companion, and in a right atmosphere restaurant, you are going to like it. So food, 4 star; overall experience, 5 star.
author: Victoria E.

description: Went here last night with a big group of friends, the owner was super sweet he brought us out some free chips and guacamole while we waited for seats to open up.  I ordered the pumpkin empanada since it sounded unique, it had pumpkin seeds I believe in it, turned out it was really good.   Next time going to try the mac and cheese, but everything we had seemed pretty yummy.  Was a little expensive for food and drinks but was a fun place and pretty good.  Some of the dinners are quite large glad I ordered something smaller probably good to try appetizers since they all looked great.  Most of my friends ordered the fish tacos which looks great as well,  May have to try them next time. Took away one star because my $12 cocktail had an icecube that basically took up the whole cup so I probably only had half a cocktail in a tiny glass so they need to use larger glasses or leave out the giant cube.
author: Nirea S.

description:
Ok, so this review comes from a vegetarian, so you can dismiss it all if you want. Much of my review, however, is not centered on anything that has to do with being a vegetarian, if any of it.

My friend is not a vegetarian and is the one who wanted to go here. They held my resie for 30 minutes after the time because I made sure to keep them informed of the horrid traffic on 101 and the amazing lack of parking in the Mission (to unusual levels) that evening. Because of my courtesy, they reciprocated, which was very very kind and professional of them. 
They were very packed for a Thurs early eve time, but we got a cute seat near the kitchen area. The decor was odd and sparse, but in a rustic way that kind of worked. 
The service all around was friendly and helpful, but sparse and had huge gaps in between when service was actually needed. Service was not consistent and there seemed to be limited communication between servers. Just to pay, took about 25 minutes to even find someone to give us the bill. /
I do not like cocktails that are not sweet, fruity, sourish..... I am a total chick like that. I asked the waitress if there even was such a cocktail on their limited cocktail menu that could possibly fit my need and she suggested the Mezcal Mule. She said it had "kick" and was sourish. She also said it had a slight smokey flavor and she loved it. I was intrigued and decided to try. Please note: I have never ever sent any cocktail back in my entire life (I am 34) and was even willing to just give it to my friend who has never rejected a cocktail in his life. I take the first sip and thought I might spit it up. He tried it and his face went dead. He said "Okay, try not smelling it as you sip it". Right then I knew I was not going to be able to even drink half. I tried two more time, however, because I was finding it hard to believe that they'd serve a completely undrinkable drink, but YUP! They do! It tasted like this (and I am not trying to be remotely over dramatic nor funny): The essence of burnt rubber, tar, and about 90% turpentine. It tasted and smelled precisely like that and was the most horrendously, putrid and vile drink of the planet! My friend motioned over for the waitress and had her replace it with something consumable. 
I got a iced tea'lemonade thing and the waitress offered to put some rum in it. I said ok and waited and about 15 minutes later some guy came over with a shot of rum and starts walking  away. I stopped him and ask where the rest of the drink it, he looked bewildered and took it away to go find it's counterpart. 10 more minutes go by and some other dude comes over and sets the same class of rum down and I stop him and say "Ok, this is what happened 1o minutes ago. I did not order just rum. The waitress said she's put this in my iced tea and lemonade mixture." He said "I will look into it" as if there was anything to "look into". Finally they get it right and my drink was at least palatable.

As for the food: we had ordered the grilled asparagus right away and it took a good 30 minutes just to get it,. Thank god we had ordered gauc and chips before, or we would had been famished! The guac was the only worthy thing we got. It was killer and worth getting to go, 
Other than that, I go the veggie skillet which was not an entree, though on the entree section. It was small and appetizer sized. The only reason I even got filled was due to the tortillas. My friend got the lobster salad and said it was average. We would had order dessert, but they really don't have a real dessert menu. 3 things and two of them are so below average for a dessert menu that they can't even be considered dessert. 

If you love faux cowboys screaming in opposing rooms at the tv like wild animals, grotesquely horrendous cocktails, below average food...then this is the place for you!!!!!!
author: Unicorn U.

description: Southwestern fusion food, flavorful and creatively presented, which hints of green chile, chipotle, and other traditional flavorings. The ribs are tender and rich, and the bartenders know what they're doing.  Tyler, manager and one of the brother/founders, is always exuberant and helpful.
author: Colin S.

description:
Finally got to try out this newish outpost by the folks who bring us Woodhouse Fish Co. last night.  Some friends took me there for my birthday and it was one of the best gifts ever.
3 of our group (out of 6) arrived about 1/2 an hour before our reservation, because we had heard good things about the cocktails and wanted to check it out.  At the early hour of 5:30, there was 1 bartender and 4 or 5 customers at the bar.  He was extremely attentive and charming, knowledgeable, and very patient in answering all of our questions about the unique cocktails and their ingredients.  All 3 of us chose the "Vagabond" based on the menu description and his explanation.  We all agreed it was one of the best and most unique cocktails we ever had.  When our 4th party member arrived, she ordered the Mule, which I tasted and also loved.  I can really see this refreshing fizzy blend of Pisco, ginger beer, and citrus served in a metal chuck-wagon cup as a perfect concoction on a warm afternoon.  Boutique cocktails are all the rage in SF right now, and the competition is stiff.  So are the drinks at West of Pecos, and at $9.00 ea. or so, a real bargain.

BAR:  Product: *****   Service: *****  Vibe:*****

When the rest of our party arrived, we were seated at a prime table at the back of the dining space.  Why was a back table prime?  We were about 12 feet from the open kitchen, so the 3 of us facing it had the extra pleasure of watching the chef, cooks, and staff work in perfect unison (and apparent happy mood, given the many smiles) to produce our food.  A grand pizza-style flaming oven (furnace?) stood at the far left of the line in which were cooking fresh house-made-to-order tortillas using a sort of peel to insert and remove them. We were watching a smooth and shiny kitchen staff having fun.  Word spread quickly around my table that very good things might be in store.
A big plus about a group of foodie friends trying out a new SF restaurant is sharing tastes. Everybody gets to sample a lot more of the menu on the 1st visit.  Such was my good lot.  Even though carnivores, vegetarians, and allergic concerns were  among our party,we had no problem at all selecting a bunch of dishes that would give all a chance to share and explore.  How San Francisco is that? 
Here is what we ordered, and how we rated each dish.  Rating is *to*****, * being pretty bad, and ***** being amazing.

APPETIZERS:*****

DUCK TACOS: ***** 
Beyond amazing.  We only ordered 1 order (3 tacos) with the aps.  nearly caused a riot at the table. Order one taco for every duck-eating member should be the rule.

HOMEMADE QUESO AND CHIPS: ***** 
I doubt the chips are house-made (will ask next time), but they are really fresh and delicious and probably local.  The Queso dip obviously is, though, and a revelation for anyone who has secretly loved jarred or movie theater "cheese" sauce.  My table insisted on cleaning the bowl with their fingers before letting it leave the table. 

CRISPY PEPPERS:  ******
Although this was nobody's favorite ap at my table, that had nothing to do with the quality or preparation.  The peppers were really tasty and great with the dip, IF YOU LIKE A BUNCH OF HEAT.  After the first one, unseeded, set my taste buds afire, I took the time to rid the rest of the peppers I ate of their seeds with my thumb before dipping and eating them and I loved them.  A little honest warning would allow the few heat addicts at my party to have a great experience without denying other palates equal opportunity to enjoy the dish.

ENTREES and SIDES: ****

SPARE RIBS W/BOURBON-PEACH BBQ SAUCE:*****
Without a doubt the biggest of many hits at the table among the carnivores. A pretty sweet sauce, but balanced nicely with enough tang and heat to avoid being cloying. This successful balance of disparate taste elements was something we found in most of WOP's dishes.  The rib meat was perfectly moist and tender.  Added bonus: generous portion for the price!  Oh, and the side of mustard slaw rocked.

1/2 ROASTED CHICKEN: *****
I am going entirely on hearsay here,as the non-red meat-eating member of our party grew silent as soon as this dish was delivered to her, and happily shoveled it down while the rest of us tasted and traded dishes.  When I finally thought to ask her about it, she said it was as good a chicken dish as she had ever had.  Good enough for me.

CARNITAS****
2 people at our table ordered these.  They had great flavor and the salsa and fresh tortillas were exceptional.  I thought the meat was a bit drier and less tender than ideal, thus the withholding of a star.

FLAT IRON STEAK*****
This was steakhouse worthy, but much more interesting.  Perfectly cooked with a great char and well seasoned.  Tender, juicy, delicious meat.

These folks know what they're doing.  Check it ou
author: Gary N.

description: I had heard alot about this resto and decided to try it out with a few friends last night. Overall service and drinks were good but we were quit disappointed with the food. I ordered the three sisters stew and had to send it back as it lacked any flavor. The waitress was kind enough to take it back and offered to ket the chef know. I also ordered the fish which was pretty bland as well. I hope its just opening month kinks and they can sort out the food.
author: Aditi K.

description:
Great place to take your out of town family visitors.  Great atmosphere.  

As for the food, we shared two entrees, beef ribs and grilled pork.  They weren't bad, but they are not worth rushing back for.  

Go here when the people you are with are more important than the food you will be eating.
author: Bruce W.

description: the food was good but a little too expensive for the portions.... however the service was great and they even made a custom dairy free dessert for my friend who is severely allergic to dairy. :)
author: Alyssa L.

description: Love this place... it's lively... the staff is friendly and happy....Try all appetizers ! Love the Texas Chili - no beans...just meat.... the flatbread... if you like spicy, you'll enjoy the fire!  Love love the pork belly w/Brussels sprouts.. nice combo... queso n chips is so so addicting...fried chicken (2 pieces... drumstick and another piece...) with mashed potatoes...I like but my least favorite!
author: Jay S.

description: Really liked this place. The sausage gravy and biscuits were a great spin on the original recipe. The queso is really good, too.  I'd go back.
author: Michael S.

description: I had the queso, flautas, ribs, all fresh, abundant, and not greasy - yay! SJ got the (not)carnitas and they weren't very warm unfortunately. Love the cute fireplace waiting area, really liked my pecos punch - Aperol yay! Our waiter was super nice. If I had been anywhere else but SF, LA, or NY I'd be happy with my meal, but with all the competition here they lack that something special.
author: J. R.

description: West of Pecos is a pretty solid spot.  Tempted to give 4 stars, but 3 seems more appropriate.  Checked it out on Saturday night and had no problem walking in without a reservation, it's a pretty big space.  Food was good, had the grilled prawns, carnitas, mac and cheese, and cornbread.  Flavors were missing something, I typically think of tex-mex as having more kick, but maybe not?  Could've used more spice in about all of the dishes.  Service was friendly and efficient.  No real complaints, but no compelling reason to go back.  But it's a good option on Valencia, it's right in the mix of it all.
author: Scott K.

description: First time here and I'm overall pleased.  Got there for a fairly early mid-week dinner and drinks and sat at a table in the bar, the rest of the place seemed a little snore-bore since it was early.  The chips are guac are delish but the portion of the guac is ridic.  Like 4 scoops and its gone, ridic.  We had to order a second serving to accomodate the 4 of us.  For my entree, shared the Prawns and the Tostada salad (with chicken).  Both were super tasty!  The service was a bit off at points, but I chalk it up to bar seating, so won't be too judgey.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Gohar J.

description: I grabbed a to go order of the mac and cheese, carnitas, veggie skillet, and corn bread. The veggie skillet was surprisingly good, but not nearly big enough to be considered an entree. Mac and cheese had an interesting kick to it with green chile peppers and was pretty good. The carnitas were just ok. There are plenty of other places in the mission to get your carnitas fix. Corn bread tasted like corn bread.
author: Hazel Joy K.

description: On a San Francisco Tuesday evening, Geo and I attempted to stop in at our weekly mainstay, Puerto Alegre, in the Mission District when Geo noticed this smart looking bar and grille named West of Pecos...  Man, were we pleasantly surprised!!!  Amazing!!!
author: Jeff G.

description: Definitely try it! The waitress made great recommendations and everything we ate was delicious. I highly recommend the prickly pecos margarita (it has a kick!), heirloom salad, and pollo asado  And with all the hot food and drink, the asparagus with the with the hollandaise did the trick. I must admit that the ribs that our "neighbor" ordered looked amazing too... next time!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Others have compared West of Pecos to Chevy's, which was initially off-putting--but a table at the window of the bar opened up just as we passed, and so my girlfriend and I took it. We immediately ordered drinks. For me the Flying Dog Gonzo Imperial Porter, 9% alcohol! She ordered the Pecos Punch, which annoyingly came in a tin campfire cup and that I thought was carrying the motif a little far. 
The food menu isn't too large and I have to say that I settled on the pork ribs, failing to be very excited about anything else. Said to be prepared with apricots, I didn't taste any. Came with a very dull tin bowl of brown beans. Ordered a side of cornbread baked with molasses that satisfied as comfort food. My lady ordered the flat-iron steak, cooked a touch rare, which spoke of attentive preparation and that ranged somewhere between okay and pretty good. 
The bar television was showing 'The Three Amigos', albeit muted. The two of us had so far managed never to see this, and we watched intermittently while drinking and between chatting. Was a bit like cooking and eating at home, and this is perhaps where the comparison to Chevy's strikes true. The food was entirely decent and appetizing, but lacked the pizzazz one looks for in dining out. The fare lacked inventiveness, which is how I personally fault Chevy's for tasting.
author: Brian G.

description: Love this place... The decor, food, service all good. Had the rodeo ghost and duck tacos at happy hour. Followed by a great dinner of cornbread, beets and Mac and cheese. Entrees included bbq chicken, lobster enchilada, Chile relleno and three types of pork. Fair prices for a good portion of food. Would definitely return if in area.
author: Gidget M.

description:
New favorite restaurant in the Mission! Everything about this place was amazing- from the food to the service, drinks, and ambiance. Delicious, filling food that was actually well priced- I couldn't get enough of the guacamole! 

Even if you are not getting dinner, this is the perfect place to stop by for delicious drinks with a group or on a date. The owners did an amazing job with the decor and layout of the place, and it's a really fun, welcoming atmosphere without feeling like you are standing on top of other people like most places nearby. 

Also I absolutely LOVED the outdoor waiting area with the fireplace. I didn't mind the wait for our table at all because I was warm and cozy, drink in hand, happily people watching. Never seen anything like it in the mission!

I'll be back very soon! Can't wait to try their brunch menu!
author: Beata B.

description: Attention to detail! Everywhere you look and everything you eat has a southwest flare that is spot on. I love this place.
author: Nicole O.

description:
I was expecting more and they underwhelmed me. Nice place and very friendly people but the food was just ok. 

My chicken was a little dry. My friend's brisket was saturated in BBQ sauce and not super tasty ... pretty average.

I was bummed because several people have raved about it.
author: Joe F.

description: Highly suggest getting the soapapilla (sp.?) such a tasty dessert! Did a little tapas action with appetizers and the carnitas pies were by far the best. Very flaky and very tasty. The chili relleno was also tasty but it came with some squash type thing that was almost served like the main ish on the plate, not the relleno. I wasn't good. Needed some more flavor and more cooking. Wait time was silly long, quoted 15 ended up being about 45. Service was solid.  Besides the dessert and the pies this would be a 3 star performance.
author: Ezra B.

description: I have been going to this place since it opened, and have generally found it a great place for delicious food at a reasonable price, and without the long waits you get in some of the "flavor of the month" restaurants on Valencia street.   However, I was just in today for brunch when I was told, when I asked for more ice tea, that they now charge for refills!  Really!?  The ice tea is already $4, more than most places, and now you want to charge for refills?  Not happy about this, may have to rethink next time we go out for brunch.
author: Andrew L.

description: Awesome place. Went here for a friend's birthday and it was the perfect venue for such a large group. We ordered all of the small plates and they were all very good. I think the duck tacos were my favorite along with the jalepeno mac and cheese. The pitchers of margaritas were delicious, as were some of the cocktails people ordered as well. Love the ambiance, and service was fantastic. Would gladly come back with friends another time.
author: Diana C.

description:
I had a great experience at West of Pecos. We went on the 2nd day after opening, so there was a bit of a wait - but that meant we got to try drinks at the bar. I had a beer, which they served in a giant, iced mug - super cool and delicious. I afterwards had one of the specialty cocktails, and it was equally as refreshing.

At dinner, we had several of their dishes, and both my friend and I loved everything we tried. I definitely recommend the cornbread!

Lastly, the ambiance over at West of Pecos is awesome. It's a decent-sized space, so it's good for groups, big or small. I definitely recommend checking it out!
author: Earl D.

description: Good happy hour tacos and texan beer, fun atmosphere!
author: Allison R.

description: Firas, michael, and last but not least TJ!!!! Made our night!!! We came for a bday dinner and came out with awesome bartenders that will forever be ingrained! Ask for the secret concoction, pilar.
author: cynthia b.

description: Great location, and the food was good, however it took some time to get the meals.  And the service staff seemed to be doing more than they should have.  The owners were very involved, which was great.  A bit noisy, and darksh.
author: Ara L.

description: Awesome place, portions are perfect, priced perfectly, everything is quality. Servers were attentive and casual and friendly, food didn't take long at all, and I actually dug the rustic western vibe (not usually my thing, but they pulled it off; it's not gaudy or hokey or that sort of decor that gives you the impression that everything is covered in dust, lol). It's actually surprisingly easy to get there for brunch; the hours for that are perfect, and the commute (if you take Van Ness to 16th) is quick and mostly painless! Huge fan of this take on Tex-Mex, which I'm not usually keen on; great balance between flavors and textures and richness. Killer place, definitely recommended! Next time for me: checking out some of those interesting brunch cocktails!
author: Dan A.

description:
Amazing cocktails. Delicious Food.  Excellent Service.  Well done, West of Pecos!

I've dined here twice over the last month and I can't wait to come back for thirds.  The Mezcal Mule wins my vote for best cocktail (plus, it's served in an awesome tin cup).  The mac 'n cheese with green chilies was so good my friend and I ordered a second.  no joke.  Other favorites included the ribs, the cornbread skillet, and the queso.  

Again, the only thing better than the food was the ambiance/service.  I sat near the door and watched one of the owners greet guests like they were his best friends.  It's nice to have a neighborhood place that feels like home.
author: Katie N.

description:
Brought our 9 month old son and our friends brought their 9 month old daughter here a few weeks ago.  The staff was especially helpful in getting us set up at a table so that the adults and kids could be comfortable.  You don't know how important that is until you have a little one.

We had a table full of food and drinks that were all delicious, but I am a sucker for things like carnitas, tortillas, queso, beer and tequila.  

It's hard to find a place where you can bring kids, get a good meal and feel like your not disturbing everyone else in the place.   West of Pecos is a big space with a great vibe and staff, especially those MacNivens who seem to have the restaurant business down to a science.  

Will be going here often with the little man in tow.
author: Trevor P.

description: Tried it out the other night. The food was great, I had the chicken, which was terrific. The service left something to be desired. After waiting the 45 minutes that the hostess had estimated, we were told we would have to wait an additional 30 minutes. I hope they get a little more organized/efficient because this seems like it could be a fun place if they work out the kinks.
author: Cee B.

description: My wife and I met some friends from out of town here on a Friday night and were able to make reservations through their Yelp Seat Me service. The staff was friendly and cordial. The restaurant itself is on the larger side and while it was loud, you could hear yourself talking. My wife and I are vegetarians and ordered the puffy taco with plantains and kale, the kale enchiladas and the chile relleno. The puffy taco was fantastic -- the shell was flaky and the filling was flavorful. The enchiladas were delicious. Often times when we get enchiladas at restaurants we can't help but feel that we could replicate it at home. In this case, we didn't as the red sauce was comforting, full of depth (but not too bold), the kale filling was perfectly tender yet not too crisp or steamed and the whole dish came together quite well without relying on mounds of cheese to make it good. The only negative in the meal was the chile relleno which was a fire roasted pepper stuffed with assorted veggies (sweet potato, corn, etc) served with a side of bland beans and rice. We wouldn't get this again. Our friends ordered the mac and cheese which was spicy and had a nice kick. We would definitely come back here and got the sense it's a nice place for a mixed crowd of vegetarians and non vegetarians. Thus far, it was one of our better mexican dining experiences in SF.
author: T K.

description: This is definitely Tex-Mex which is fine, next door you can go to puerto alegre for more authentic mexican if you wish. The atmosphere is very nice along with the decor. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The prices are not too bad, and the food was decent portions and was delicious. They have some fun aspects like serving certain drinks in prison cups. It has a nice bar to stop by for just a drink as well.
author: Cody H.

description: Went to this place 2 weeks after being open so maybe they're still getting into the groove. Anyway, we had a bad experience with the bbq ribs. They were already cut up and slathered in sauce when served to us. When we bit into them, they smelled kinda bad. Like that musty pork smell. It was not appetizing at all, so we had to give them back. Luckily, they were very understanding and apologized for our experience, hence the 3 stars instead of 2. Everything else we ordered was ok, but nothing super awesome. I'll give it to them for comfortable seating and decor.
author: Den M.

description: tuna tacos were amazing. nice selection of margaritas. mac and cheese is a nice app. it is a bit trendy looking for the mission, but the food makes up for the lack of authentic mexican decor. it is a Tex mex spot anyway....
author: Chucky B.

description:
This place was truly wonderful for brunch. The owner is incredibly accommodating and gave us the best seat in the house by the window. Decor is great, rustic, and very homey.

We had the brunch vegan chorizo scramble and the chilaquiles. Both were outstanding. 

Even better than our food were the bloody Mary's. Outstanding! Roasted tomatoes and pepper- mmm gourmet with a touch of spice. So delicious, I wish I knew how to recreate them!

I will certainly be back to check out the dinner menu!
author: Samantha H.

description: This is my favorite new restaurant in SF. The atmosphere is super cool, with a very Southwestern feel...reminds me of a trip I took to Santa Fe. On top of that, the cocktails are great and the food is delicious! What more could you ask for? The guacamole is actually one of the best I've ever had.
author: Meg B.

description: Great food and great space. We were a bit annoyed that two of us could not be seated even though half the restaurant was still empty. Got there early, so I'm assuming they must have everything booked up  the following half hour. We sat on the bar instead. Loved the decor. I had a Chile Poblano Relleno which was super tasty. The Guacamole's were perfect and even the tortilla chips were exceptional. We'll be back.
author: Josu G.

description: 5 stars all around! The food-atmosphere and especially the service! Loved the design of the restaurant too. I couldn't stop looking around at all the cool stuff on walls. The menu was very unique. Can't go without the guac/cheese dip starter or the brisket sandwich. It literally melts in your mouth!  We stocked up on drinks and they were all fantastic. Definitely get the punch bowl to share! I have to mention the service. The manager, Mike went above and beyond to make sure we were enjoying ourselves throughout our meal. His genuine care for our experience added to an already fantastic night. You can tell he really enjoys what he does! I will definitely be suggesting it to the guests at my hotel looking for a great spot in the heart of the mission! Cant wait to come back!
author: EM B.

description: This place had to grow on me. Kitschy Texas decor, smug hipsters dominating the bar, a little gimmicky. But the staff are friendly and helpful, the burger wrap is amazing, and brunch was exceptional. And as the new patina wears off, it's gaining some character.
author: Raison C.

description: My husband and I are new to the Mission, so we have been trying out new restaurants every week. We skipped West of Pecos multiple times because it looks like a large chain restaurant from the outside. One Friday night we wandered in there and were extremely pleasantly surprised by our food. We are both pescaterians so we got the prawns and the grilled artichoke with crab. The dishes were WONDERFUL! We also got the sopapilla for dessert, which was to die for. In my opinion, they could have more vegetarian/pescaterian, which is why I didn't give this place 5 stars. Overall, awesome food, awesome drinks, awesome service, good ambiance, and definitely affordable. Give West of Pecos a shot and I'm sure you won't be disappointed.
author: Nicholle Z.

description: A jewel we found while wandering around looking for a good restaurant. They were very accommodating for our party of 10; and the chefs are OFF THE CHART! Everything we had was scrumptious! Our entire group of 10 LOVED their dish! Albondigas are a must!
author: Valerie S.

description: I went awhile ago and don't remember what I ordered but it was really tasty.  Nice atmosphere too.
author: Angela R.

description: fun for big groups! they have mezcal mules - big plus. the tuna tacos are miniscule. the fish tacos are very big and delicious. the pork trio is medium sized and delicious.
author: Sonya Z.

description: New place, great bartenders. The wait was 1.5 hrs on opening weekend so we made our way to the bar. Best decision ever. Mike makes some awesome unique spicy drinks. TJ and Disasters kept them flowing and delicious. Get the Pilar or any of the signature margaritas. Bar food and drinks were enough to get us to turn down our table when it was available. Get the prawns!
author: Jessica H.

description: So the only reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because my husband and I went to WOP twice and the first experience was great and so delicious! Needless to say, we should've left it at that.  We went back a couple weeks later with some friends and had the most awful experience. We went on a Saturday evening, and yes Valencia St is busy and we understand there's a wait time, places are crowded, etc. Once we were actually seated, we were so excited... that excitement slowly dissipated as we ended up sitting at our table for about 45 min before our order was even taken - had we not flagged down our server it may have been longer. Once we ordered (along with another round of drinks) we waited for another 40 min! Meanwhile, the restaurant is slowly clearing out and all the tables around us are getting their food. One of our friends actually got up to check on our orders, since our server - Megan - was nowhere to be found. The manager of the evening came by our table to apologize, stating that our order had gotten "lost" and our food was getting plated. Once we actually got our food, my order was wrong, but at this point I didn't even care because I was so hungry. Someone else in our party pointed it out however, and my dish was comped and I got a new (and correct) dish in a matter of minutes. Mind you, still no Megan. Everyone was less than impressed with the food and the experience overall, and we were ready to hit the road. Meanwhile, we finally see Megan check on her other tables around us and she completely ignores us. Once our plates are cleared we wait about another 15-20 min to get our check and AGAIN have to flag someone down for it. TERRIBLE! Seriously, worst service, and the food is OK. Definitely not worth the money or the total waste of time. Apparently Megan, is normally  "an excellent server" and the manager assured he was going to have a talk with her. B.S and who cares... never going back!
author: Elly M.

description:
Bad food, arrogant staff, uncaring owner who, when told that the men's room had NO SOAP, just shrugged his shoulders and said, "Oh well!"

If you want to get food-borne illness or some other bacteria, go here, otherwise, take your cash and friends and head to another Valencia corridor eatery and have a good time!
author: Ted K.

description:
3.5 rounded to 4. Been there for brunch several times. Service has been consistently good. Food is pretty god as well. My favs are the corn bread and pancakes. 
In 2 instances I noticed what I got charged on the bill were different from the prices on the menu. I pointed them out and they fixed my bill.  However, my lack of trust will linger no doubt.
author: teatzar s.

description: Great food, of a type that is not that common in Northern California. SUPER FRIENDLY staff who really seem to care that you are there. I love this place.
author: Willie P.

description:
You know you're at a so-so place when the first two entrees you ask the waiter about receive a Lumberg-esque, "Ummmm, yeah, about that..."

Ended up with the pollo asado which was decent, but not nearly as good as Limon or Green Chile Kitchen (I know the latter two are rotiserrie, so it's not an apples to apples comparison, but still, this wasn't great). 

On the plus side, the cornbread skillet was quite delicious, and they have Shiner Bock. 

Bottom line: Only go here if your preferred restaurant has an hour-long wait and you're really hungry.
author: Kevin R.

description: I came here for happy hour with my colleagues recently.  The prices for happy hour drinks and snacks are a fantastic deal.  The service ranged from mediocre to subpar.  The person who took my order made a mistake and ended up bringing me an additional order of food.  When I pointed out the mistake, she nervously said sorry and shrugged.
author: Seghel Y.

description: This has become my new go to spot in the Mission.  It's large enough that you don't have to wait hours for a table, but still exclusive enough that it's never empty.  It's versatile because you can meet up for just drinks, just a few small plates or go for a full on dinner.  I was trying to think of my favorite dishes and realized I love them all - but really the stuffed avocado small plate is a MUST.  I think that the owner/host is one of the nicest I've ever met, always super smiley and friendly and if our server gets busy he picks up the slack.  AND I'm from Texas 'nough said.  This place is good.
author: Liz M.

description:
Went to West of Pecos a couple nights ago (not for the first time) with a large group of friends and got the coffee-rubbed brisket sandwich. It was really good, flavorful brisket and a nice side of fries and coleslaw. I washed it down with a bourbon drink called "Devil's Tooth". I gotta warn you, it's hard to drink just one. If you don't like bourbon, they have some great Tequila and Mezcal drinks as well. Some other folks got the cornbread and mac-n-cheese, both very tasty. My favorite dish here has got to be the ribs though. Trust me, you won't go wrong with that choice.

Overall, a great, lively place in the heart of the Mission with great food, great drinks, and a fun (if loud) atmosphere.
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
I LOVE this place!! I've been quite a few times now and it seems to get better and better every time. Everyone who works there is super friendly. The service is attentive and professional. The cocktails are perfection - my favorite is the Mezcal Mule (and I'm typically not a fan of Mezcal). The prickly pear margarita is a second favorite. 
The menu has recently changed - and for the better! I loved the food before but it's EXCEPTIONAL now. 

A few of my favorites:

Bacon Wrapped Prawns - one word - Bacon. How could it be anything but delicious? I'm in love with this dish. 

Little Gem Salad - I could drink the dressing on this salad, it's that good. 

Roasted Half Chicken - tender, juicy chicken served with the BEST creamed corn. 

Campfire Cornbread - warm cornbread with fresh corn inside and drizzled with warm molasses...I could eat this for every meal. 

Pecos is great for large parties and small. I highly recommend sitting on their outdoor patio next to the fireplace.
author: A. K.

description:
If you've been looking for relatively healthy yet very tasty food, this is it. California fresh-Mex meets spicy and innovative. Great margaritas and bar scene too. Prices are reasonable. I had the Pollo Asado Al Carbon and it was spectacular - juicy, spicy, great corn and roasted garlic on the side. The Caesar salad was unique - cheesy, spicy, but still a Caesar.

I'll be going back, a lot. This is my favorite of all of the new restaurants in the Valencia corridor. Maybe the only downside is that parking can be tough, but that's the Mission these days.
author: Naval R.

description: One of my favorite spots in the mission hands down. Sure, the food is great, but I keep coming back because Tyler and his team are incredible when it comes to service and making sure each individual is taken care of. Treated my girlfriend with utmost respect while I parked the car for 15 minutes. It's the little things and these folks totally don't miss a beat.
author: Ryan D.

description: Great fun to eat there.  I'd had dinner there with friends and family twice now.  The menu has so many tempting options, both times we ordered several dishes and shared.  Great food - fun atmosphere!
author: Karen H.

description:
Went on a rainy saturday night and had a flat iron steak, lamb & chorizo meatballs, and a side. The food was okay but not spectacular - I'm in no way a food snob but there was just nothing to rave about. One of the owners spent the first part of our meal talking over us to the adjacent table, attempting to get himself a free distillery tour from some apparently special guest. 

The mezcal mule was the only standout, and our server was just the right amount of attentive. 4 stars for the drink and service, 0 for the owner.
author: Joe S.

description: I stumbled in here after a night at 1015 Folsom desperately seeking a bloody mary and eggs. What I found was a pulverized tomato art piece that tasted like sheer genius, and the eggs were a scramble of chili-infused tastebud-mangling joy. Side note: sat on the front table outside on a 40 degree day with a pretty girl, and the manager came out, lit a fire next to us on the rustic hearth, turned on the overhead twinkling lights, and then mentioned that a 12-piece mariachi band would come to serenade us. We laughed it off... until the musicians started massing in front of our table. I would go here again and again.
author: Gordon M.

description: Visited this new valencia street bar and restaurant last night and walked away very impressed and very full. Excellent selection of tequila and mezcals in the bar mixed up into some very yummy cocktails. I had the Mezcal Mule, served in very cute tin campsite style cups, and the Pilar which pairs tequila/grapefruit/chipotle to excellent effect. For dinner my friend and I shared the grilled prawns appetizer (this was a standout) the carnitas and the veggie skillet. Everything was really tasty and the service was attentive and lovely. It's a huge space as well.. Would be great for a big group dinner. Cheers to the owners. Ill be back for sure.
author: Lindsey W.

description: Love this place!  Great bar, atmosphere and comfortable food.
author: Bruce P.

description:
We went for dinner on a Thursday night. The ambiance was very nice. Modern and comfortable. It was very dark so it was hard to read the menu. The hostess provided flashlights to help us out. 

The guacamole with chips was basically just big chunks of fresh avocado with a few pieces of tomato and corn mixed in. Completely lacked flavor. It came with a wedge of lime and lemon so I was able to add that to the smashed avocado with some salt. Sorely missed onion, jalapeno, and cilantro.The chips were nice and thick which was needed to scoop up the avocado. 

I ordered the carnitas which came with another big scoop of guacamole! The carnitas were very tender, tasted more braised than roasted and came with an overpowering sauce and some delicious tortillas. Would have preferred a different side dish. 

The ribs were tender but again the sauce was just overpowering the flavor of the meat

The arugula and goat cheese salad was wonderful. Great combination of textures and flavors. 

Would not eat there again.
author: Bonnie L.

description: I had brunch here and was quite impressed. The poached eggs were spicy and delicious, not an eggs benedict but not entirely dissimilar. I'll be back.
author: R O.

description: Sooooo good. This place is great for large groups. Nice casual atmosphere and great food. What's not to love.
author: quinn B W.

description: Great food and drinks and a fun place for a girls night out! Would definitely come back again
author: Natan R.

description: Got to happy hour 5-6:30PM for the tastiest gourmet mini tacos at $1.50 each!
author: Kim C.

description: I never give 5 stars, so 4 is max for me. What a great find this was. Very tasty food at reasonable prices. Friendly and accommodating staff and wait persons. Good portions. Special requests no problem. Salads, ribs and chicken skewers are some of the best in SF. So are cocktails. Plenty of options for nondrinkers too. A great vibe too. Outside seating a plus.
author: Nick P.

description: Fly to Texas instead. I'm not sure what these guys are making, but it's not the deliciousness I've had several times in place like Austin and Lockhart. Plus, there are so many better options within a five minute walk from here. Maybe we just ordered poorly, but we won't be going back - walked out with 2/3 still on the plate.
author: Eric O.

description:
Each of the 3 times I've been to West of Pecos since its opened I've been made to feel very special. I've been impressed with their refreshing take on the southwest theme, as before this it existed in the back of my mind as a 1980's howling coyote design nightmare-their take is clean and warm . Drinks: up there with all the fun and foo foo cocktails that SF has to offer-but less foo foo because of all the tequila! Tortillas: awesome! Duck: delicious!!

I'll be back, and I'll recommend.
author: Felicia F.

description: California style Tex-Mex, don't ask, just try it. Who knew CA could do Tex-Mex better than the Everything's Bigger state.
author: Moses L.

description:
We hit West of Pecos opening night (yeah, this is an overdue review), and I'm definitely wanting to go back. The cocktails were super tasty all around; the staff and service were great; the ambiance was totally appropriate and fun.

I'm a native Texan and I definitely felt like the food lived up to it's name of WEST of the Pecos... much more of a Southwest/New Mexico flair than East Texas (Dallas, Houston, San Antonio, Austin) Tex-Mex. 

The house-made tortillas were priced high for the number in the order ($2 per tortilla? Really?), but the cornbread skillet was fantastic AND they served it "correctly" with a side of molasses. I'll definitely be ordering the Grilled Young Asparagus again. Everything else our table ordered was solid (Messy Texas Ribs, Three Cheese Poblano Relleno, and the Flat Iron Steak). Dessert was the ice cream trio (Sweet Corn, Chipotle Chocolate, Lavender) served with tasty, possibly fried cookies. 

We enjoyed our meal, but I'll opt to try new entrees next time I'm in. And there will be a next time.
author: Kate B.

description: This place is amazing!! Tyler (co-owner) is the absolute nicest and so much fun! He came over to talk to our table multiple times and comped two order of chips and guac for our table. He really welcomed us in and made our experience here so much fun!! I will certainly return here!!! The food and drinks are great as well!
author: Ashley S.

description: it could have been easily a 4 or 5 stars if it wasn't for Mr bartender who took a half hour to notice that we are actually waiting to get drinks and not look at his pretty face , it would have been nice if he said , hey gentlemen how are i will be right with you ! ,,, anyways other than that ,they have good cocktails and beer,. white beer on draft amazing , and victoria on draft even better , food was good , half chicken came with an amazing side of  creamy corn that had a liquorice taste to it , and also the poblano relleno was just perfect , will probably be back very soon ...
author: NAEL K.

description:
Best cold beer in the mission, hands down.  Ribs were great too.  If you're looking for a monster beer in an ice cold chalice you'll love this place.  My wife and I stopped by on a week night for a meal and some after work drinks.  The bar is huge and easy to get a drink.  If you're interested in tequila you won't be disappointed.

My wife wasn't so interested in chill-in at the bar so we were quickly seated for dinner.  We split the ribs, flat iron steak with a side of green chile mac and cheese.  As you can imagine the mac & cheese was tasty and the green chiles were definitely a welcome addition.  The ribs were the best part of the meal and one dish we'll be back for.

Being a mission regular, I look for the restaurants that are clean, good vibe, and great drinks.  I'll be back.  Maybe without the wife.
author: Todd W.

description:
Could not get an early dinner reservation on UrbanSpoon, but decided to stop by anyway.  Were warmly greeted at the door by Tyler and Dylan, who welcomed us and let us know that they save tables for walk-ins.

Got a great table in the middle section of the very clean, modern and interesting space.  The place is popular with a trendy, young crowd, so it gets noisy by around 7pm.  It is a great place to talk with a friend over an early dinner.

Service was excellent and non-intrusive.  Our server, Mallory, was very helpful and knew the menu.

My friend does not eat red meat, so we tried some things I wouldn't usually order.  All the food was really good, and there were a couple of things that were memorable.  Also, my prickly pear margarita was excellent and had a spicy kick to it.

Skillet corn bread w/molasses on the side is a must-have.  I'm not really a starch person, but I will order this every time that I'm there.

Ceviche stuffed artichoke - another memorable dish.  The same people own Woodhouse Fish Company and I order that version of this dish whenever I am there.  I enjoyed this one even more.  The aoli and salad dressing had a great spicy kick and the ceviche, including the octopus, was very tender.

The lavender duck, drunken beans and goat cheese salad were also very good.  Though when I return I look forward to trying some of their meat dishes.

Happy to have this place in the neighborhood.
author: Megami F.

description: Pecos margarita yumm just the right amount of spice. Food is good def texmex which if your Mexican is not always your fav type of food but they def do it right fav texmex place ive been to so far
author: Cynthia P.

description: Sat outside by the fireplace on rainy night with a few friends and sampled a handful of everything...Guacamole, Jalapeno mac and cheese, fish tacos, the green chile burger, pork...etc.  Everything was great, presented well, and the service was on point.  The bar was cool too and a lot of people hanging out, mingling.  Definitely going to hit the rewind button on this one.
author: jacob s.

description:
I wish I could give this place a better review but we were horribly ignored when my husband and I tried to get a drink here recently.  
We first tried sitting at the bar, but the bartender didn't so much as acknowledge us.  I thought maybe he was just busy at first because he had about 5 server tickets he was tending to, but we felt like he could at least have let us know he saw us and say he'd be right with us but nope.  For about 10 minutes he just kept his head down and ignored us.  He only had two other folks at the bar and the restaurant really was pretty slow when we went in.
We finally decided to sit at a table in the bar area, hoping we'd give service quicker that way and a busser quickly brought us water and menus.  A server did come over and say she'd be right with us, so I was hopeful!  But another 10 minutes passed and... she still hadn't come back.  
So we decided 20 minutes was a little too long to wait for a drink in an almost empty bar... and went ahead and left.
The place was cute though, wish I would say we'd be back to give it another shot but that most likely won't happen.
author: M S.

description: It's like a generic suburban strip-mall restaurant plunked right in the middle of valencia street.  The food, while artfully described, was uniformly... underwhelming. Guacamole that seemed to consist of nothing more than chunked avocados, utterly bland posole with watery, defeated hominy; leathery, greasy flautas; a shrimp appetizer featuring mealy shrimp of extremely dubious freshness; a heap of carnitas that begged for some sort of flavor, but could only turn to an empty "red sauce" for assistance. Alll this eaten in the context of Navajo-style rugs, hokey beaded cow skulls and faux adobe. When you walk out, you're shocked to rediscover that you're right in the heart of San Francisco, not in a giant parking lot off an interstate exchange.  What a waste of a giant space in a prime location.
author: nicky c.

description: Best damn flank steak I've had in years. When I went it was packed and happy hour so they sat us at the bar while we waited. Which was great. Excellent margaritas and queso dip. I haven't had anything I didn't like here. Also they have fried green tomatoes, who can hate that?
author: m r.

description: The food is delicious, and nicely combines comfort food with innovative twists. The green chile Mac and cheese, the mustard coleslaw, and the brisket sandwich are examples. Most surprising were the mixed drinks; no Life Savers-flavored martinis here but tasty, earthy, savory, warm flavors.
author: Galen G.

description: Such a great spot. Highly recommend going if you haven't been. Order the ribs and cornbread - you won't be disappointed!
author: John B.

description: FANTASTIC food, great bar menu, good service but....a very loud establishment. I didn't mind it as it allows you to really talk with excitement but if you have others in your party that want to have an intimate conversation....forget it, don't bring them. Healthy, fresh food with special twists. Loved my flat iron steak with a spicy sauce, a whole roasted garlic bulb, potato and kale salad (little dry on the dressing or not marinated long enough). Others in our party gave rave reviews to: kobe burgers, artichokes stuffed with seafood, roasted chicken, mac & cheese, kale salads, etc. etc. Check it out....definitely worth it!
author: P G.

description: chill place for drinks. there's a happy hour menu for drinks and apps unti i think 6. food was good! i hadn't before eaten tex mex and i really like their version. get the green mac and cheese. and if you like hot sauce, their house sauce is bomb.
author: Susan H.

description: Yummy and fresh and non-boring combinations! I enjoy everything I ate there.b
author: Shirley W.

description: An amazing place all together! New bar staff with many improved cocktails! The food is excellent and the staff very friendly. Great place to bring big parties. They take reservations and since its fairly new I recommend getting one. Love Pecos!
author: Rowan M.

description: Great atmosphere, drinks are top notch, and the service is great.  Unfortunately the food does not follow.  The apps were decent as we tried a handful and I especially liked the carnitas empanadas.  Come to the main dishes and they are subpar BBQ.  The ribs were so spicy I could barely eat them and they were served with beans soaked in what looked/tasted like watery ketchup.  Someone at our table had to send their food back, as the pork chop that was served was a horrible cut of fat and literally had no meat.  How it even left the kitchen in the first place is beyond me.  The main dishes are not over priced which was a relief. My suggestion is to come in for drinks and appetizers, skip the main dishes.
author: Ronald Z.

description: Great drinks, great atmosphere and great food! The service is super friendly and they squeeze fresh limes for the margaritas. What else could one ask for?
author: Jen E.

description:
sigh-- $15 for dry/overcooked carnitas, when there's a zillion great local joints in the neighborhood?

ambience and service were great.  The guac & chips were very good (but expensive).

reading the other reviews, seems like WoP has set a high standard for themselves, but the food needs an upgrade.
author: adam s.

description: Every time I've been here, I've had a great time. I don't do flowery obnoxious yelp reviews. I just wanted to take a moment to recognize a new restaurant that is obviously trying really hard to do a good job. The food was delicious, especially the veggie skillet, the drinks are delicious, and I'd like to draw particular attention to the service. Every person we dealt with was noticeably friendly, prompt, gracious and unobtrusive. On my way out one person, I'm assuming the shift manager, went out of his way to thank us and wish us all a good night. In a neighborhood with too many restaurants staffed by surly kids who obviously feel their work is beneath them, it was so refreshing to feel my business was appreciated.
author: Diana S.

description: I was pleasantly surprised the first time I came here. A warm, cozy atmosphere with southwest motif, friendly attentive wait staff, yummy, generously portioned, affordably priced, tex-mex cuisine. I was definitely looking forward to our second visit and this is the visit that prompted a review.  Unfortunately we didn't have a reservation (which I highly recommend because they are usually quite busy) (happy for them) so we waited, and waited and waited. We were ready to leave when we saw the manager outside. (His name is Tyler and he is amazing!) He saw the disappointed look on our faces and immediately sprang into action (He has so much energy!) in attempt to remedy the situation. He asked us to please come back and allow him the opportunity to make things right. He went above and beyond! He immediately got us a table with appetizers awaiting us then brought out a pitcher of margaritas, he actually went even further and picked up the check for the entire meal. I am so overwhelmed by not just his generosity but his desire to keep his customers happy, ensuring they will return. I will return and I will tell everyone I know because I think it is so important to support local businesses especially when they care so much for their customers.  Thank You Tyler! Wishing you many years of success!
author: Trish D.

description: A really fun experience!  Our group of six ( my son and his friends) got to sample a number of appetizers and main courses- all of which were good and some were outstanding ( quac.,corn bread, ribs, desserts).  My son and his friends raved about the the quality of the drinks.  What I enjoyed most was the friendly, welcoming atmosphere.  The service was skillful and prompt and the owner went from table to table greeting people and making sure the everyone was well taken care of.  I can't wait to go back.
author: kat b.

description: good happy hour. well whiskey is buffalo trace for 3 bucks. solid food and good portions. Great service.
author: Tim B.

description: Just enjoyed some really great chips and guacamole. Had the ribs for dinner and they were quite good. Waitress was very nice and very knowledgeable and helpful when making choices about the menu.
author: Matthew C.

description: Very sad to know, a great decorated restaurant , good food, if the order is right which is not.. The manager can not contriol his  mistakes that occur on the floor from the waiting staff. We were so excited to try this venue on Valencia street, it started out good, then the bottom  it, the waitress did not know her liquor, and served the wrong crappy dessert, it was totally wrong, did care, them manager wanted to come to us said there was a mistake and he was scared of that took place, I called the management a week later to complain about what happen and the would take care of it, never called back the don't give a shit about there restaurant, they need to close the doors for good..
author: Kris L.

description: Slow service, salad was soaked in oil, omelette was drenched in salt, chips weren't fully cooked, soggy and half were still tortillas.  The only decent thing were the drinks though they tasted nothing like a bloody mary should there were still tasty.  The decor was nice but reminded me of a bad tex mex place in the suburbs.
author: Briana B.

description: We celebrated Bryan's 50th at West of Pecos. We hired out the party room for a reasonable fee. We had 52 people in our party. Tyler and his crew made everything great!! Every table had a pitcher of margaritas that was kept full throughout the night. The kitchen had no trouble keeping up with our needs. And the food was perfect! LOVE these guys and will be back again and again.
author: Dan D.

description: West of Pecos serves south west fusion comfort food. For drinks we had the mezcule mule and a strawberry like margarita. Don't order them if you don't like spicy cocktails. I typically don't but they were still pretty fresh tasting and tart. We ordered off the bar menu cause there weren't any seats left in the restaurant area. It was a full house for a Tuesday night surprisingly. Bar menu was nice because most items were actually under 10 bucks including the drinks. I ordered the burger, mac and cheese, and potatoes. No need to order the potatoes if you're ordering the burger as it comes with it already. The burger was bun-less and was wrapped in a warm tortilla with cheese and green chili. The burger meat was a bit too thick and a bit dry for my taste but the green chili was a nice touch and added that special twist to make the dish stand out. The potatoes that came with the burger were delicious. They were almost more like a crispy home fry, which is a good thing in my book. The mac and cheese was amazing here! A bit wet and runny but still very hot and crispy at the top. The cheese had a certain spice to it which made the dish feel unique. The servers and host were really nice and attentive. I asked for my burger to be cut in half and they brought it out on two separate dishes which was nice and unexpected. The decor of the place is very comfy and modern, way more swank than a Chevy's could ever be. It does feel kinda box like inside but I probably should just have another drink and stop staring at the ceiling. Would really love to check out this place again.
author: Charlie L.

description: tex-mex done the right way...great spot to order different dishes and share with friends.  Must try the HUGE margarita and queso....
author: ann l.

description: This place is great! I went there last night for my friends birthday and they treated everyone super well. They were completely accommodating for our large group of people and instead of being weirded out, they were totally entertained by the fact we were all dressed as superheros. I think at one point in the evening they even played the superman theme song on their overhead speakers. They also played the birthday song over their speakers when they brought his cake out! ALSO not only did they bring out the cake, the greeted my friend with a birthday shot of tequila and a candle to blow out! The food was suuuper yummy. I got the Lavender and chipotle duck breast. Points for both creativity and taste! They also had this yummy spicy mac and cheese! I stole a bite off my boyfriends plate and now I know thats what I want to order next time I go. And trust me, there will be a next time, and a time after that, and after that!
author: Ann T.

description: mezcal, margaritas, mexican. making miracles happen.
author: Ben B.

description: I've had a lot of good times, I lot of hearty food, and a lot of tasty drinks since West of Pecos opened in May. I love the atmosphere, the service and the friendly wait staff. The menu continues to evolve, but the cornbread served in a mini skillet and the green chile mac and cheese have delivered since the start and its tough to resist ordering those as appetizers whenever I'm there. I eat mostly veggie fare, and the veggie skillet is fresh and always cooked to perfection for me - and it's plenty of food to fill you up. They also do brunch now, which. I've started waking up salivating on Saturday mornings thinking about West of Huevos, which is there version of Huevos Rancheros. The red chile sauce is what makes it. Pecos is also great just for grabbing drinks with friends, and there's plenty of interesting cocktails to try. If you haven't come, check it out. It's different from anything else in the Mission!
author: Hadley R.

description: Enjoyed an early dinner for my birthday after seeing dia de los Muertos Concert on a Saturday.  Prickly Pear Margaritas were pretty & delicioso!  I had the carnitas and with a little help..licked my plate clean. My sister had the chille relleno which was also yummy.  Everything I sampled was good and the service was great as well.  We will go back again for sure!
author: Katie H.

description: Loved this place. The atmosphere is eclectic and fun (the decor is awesome!), the mixed drinks fantastic (I had the Mescal Mule and another, bourbon-based drink), and the food really tasty. Loved the asparagus and the chili mac and cheese. The service was a real plus---friendly, engaging, and prompt, despite the crowdedness of the restaurant. I know there's a lot of Mexican and "pan-Latin" food in the area (this is the Mission, after all), but this provides a different, more upscale and hip, experience. It's also very versatile, the sort of place you could meet up with your (youngish) friends for a drink or take your parents when they are visiting. Anyway, I'm sad it opened only a few months before I had to move away from SF. But I'll be back the next time I'm in town!
author: Devin C.

description: Just stopped by here for the first time and had to go back a couple days later because I was DYING for the green chile mac and cheese. This place feels like home, not only due to its delicious green chile, but also because of its fireplaces outside, and the lighting and feel inside. The stuffed poblano chile was fantastic, and the tequila was supreme. I will certainly be back soon!
author: Lucia L.

description: This place deserves no more than 1 star.  In my entire 20 year history of living in San Francisco, I have never had a margarita as bad and distasteful as the one I had here.  While waiting for our table to be ready next door at Puerta, we decided to pop into West of Pecos and try a margarita.  Worst mistake of my life.  At first we thought that $8 for a margarita was a bit pricey when compared to next door.  There was three of us and we all ordered margaritas.  When it arrived at our table, we were completely shocked as to the size of the glass.  The size was ridiculous.  It must have been about the size of a training cup for a small child!!!  No kidding.  Next, at least 85% of the glass was filled with large cubes of ice...!!! The next 14% was some awful sour mix and then just a hint of tequila..!!! None of us were happy with this so called margarita and one of us expressed his opinion with the bartender who didn't seem to care take the feedback seriously.  Based on this I will never step foot in there.  Their neighbor Puerta next door is a hundred times better.  Please stay away from this place.
author: Ricky H.

description: keep up the great work!  everything is spot on - Christmas chiles, guacamole, grilled meats, margaritas.  folks seeking "tex mex" - this is way better than "tex mex" and southwestern is a more accurate description.
author: Em P.
